title: Options for file formats
text: Grib files long used store meteorological data. binary data format store “messages” 2d fields. message accompanied metadata describe geographic projection data grid . metadata also includes key-value pairs describe data - .e. parameter, vertical level , etc. {harpIO} harnesses {Rgrib2} package read data grib files, making use key-value pairs extract correct 2d fields files. Behind scenes, {Rgirb2} uses ecCodes system library, includes lookup tables many different operational centres. built harp parameters (see show_harp_parameters()), extraction grib messages done based grib shortName, indicatorOfTypeOfLevel, level, dataDate, dataTime stepRange keys. Additionally, ensemble forecasts perturbationNumber key used different ensemble members file. cases, values used keys may compatible key-value pairs used grib files. example, different forecast centres may use values shortName key listed lookup tables included ecCodes, store fields vertical levels consistent {harpIO} expects. order address grib_opts() function can used set file_format_opts argument calls read_forecast() read_grid() specific key-value pairs can used override built {harpIO}. following examples, use read_grid() read gridded data grib file {harpData} package, first create path file. export system variable can use system command, grib_ls ecCodes get summary content grib file. -p tag used just select keys might interested .

title: Options for file formats
text: take example grib message shortName “tp”, can read without problem using harp parameter “Pcp”: However, reason wanted use “Precip” instead “Pcp” parameter name. read_grid() know shortName search , attempt find message shortName = “precip”, won’t able find anything. Note also uses levelType = 255 level = -999. means find messages shortName = “precip”, ignore type level read messages levels. can use grib_opts() argument param_find force look shortName “tp” instead. param_find must named list name parameter requested, elements can set using use_grib_*() function, listed help grib_opts(). set grib shortName look , use use_grib_shortName() function. can also read one variable way - example, let’s say want read 2m temperature, precipitation total cloud cover - stick harp name, “T2m”, 2m temperature use different names precipitation (Precip, shortName = “tp”) total cloud cover (Cloud, shortName = “tcc”). set output read_grid() data frame, can see modified parameter names used.
code: read_grid(grib_file, "Pcp") #> Reading /home/andrewts/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.3/harpData/grib/AROME_Arctic/2018/07/10/00/fc2018071000+006grib_fp #> eidb : TP Total precipitation kg m**-2  #> Time: #>  2018/07/10 00:00 #> Domain summary: #> 100 x 100 domain #> Projection summary: #> proj= lcc  #> NE = ( 23.31109 , 78.2607 ) #> SW = ( 8.042 , 77.968 ) #> Data summary: #> 0 0.2287102 0.5398808 1.363777 1.41673 32.08449 read_grid(grib_file, "Precip") #> Warning: Parameter "Precip" (shortName: "Precip", typeOfLevel: "unknown" for #> level(s) -999) not found in grib file. #> Error: None of the requested data could be read from grib file: /home/andrewts/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.3/harpData/grib/AROME_Arctic/2018/07/10/00/fc2018071000+006grib_fp read_grid(   grib_file,   "Precip",   file_format_opts = grib_opts(     param_find = list(Precip = use_grib_shortName("tp"))   ) ) #> Reading /home/andrewts/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.3/harpData/grib/AROME_Arctic/2018/07/10/00/fc2018071000+006grib_fp #> eidb : TP Total precipitation kg m**-2  #> Time: #>  2018/07/10 00:00 #> Domain summary: #> 100 x 100 domain #> Projection summary: #> proj= lcc  #> NE = ( 23.31109 , 78.2607 ) #> SW = ( 8.042 , 77.968 ) #> Data summary: #> 0 0.2287102 0.5398808 1.363777 1.41673 32.08449 read_grid(   grib_file,   c("Cloud", "T2m", "Precip"),   file_format_opts = grib_opts(     param_find = list(       Precip = use_grib_shortName("tp"),       Cloud  = use_grib_shortName("tcc")     )   ) ) #> Reading /home/andrewts/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.3/harpData/grib/AROME_Arctic/2018/07/10/00/fc2018071000+006grib_fp #> <harp_geolist[3]> #> [[1]] <numeric geofield [100 x 100] Min = 0.000 Max = 1.000 Mean = 0.968> #> [[2]] <numeric geofield [100 x 100] Min = 0.000 Max = 32.084 Mean = 1.364> #> [[3]] <numeric geofield [100 x 100] Min = 270.902 Max = 279.981 Mean = 276.333> read_grid(   grib_file,   c("Cloud", "T2m", "Precip"),   file_format_opts = grib_opts(     param_find = list(       Precip = use_grib_shortName("tp"),       Cloud  = use_grib_shortName("tcc")     )   ),    data_frame = TRUE ) %>%    select(-ends_with("dttm"), -members) #> Reading /home/andrewts/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.3/harpData/grib/AROME_Arctic/2018/07/10/00/fc2018071000+006grib_fp #> # A tibble: 3 × 7 #>   lead_time step_range parameter level_type level units    gridded_data #>       <dbl> <chr>      <chr>     <chr>      <int> <chr>       <geolist> #> 1         6 6          Cloud     height         0 fraction  [100 × 100] #> 2         6 0-6        Precip    height         0 kg/m^2    [100 × 100] #> 3         6 6          T2m       height         2 K         [100 × 100]

title: Options for file formats
text: cases grib lookup table used may local version included ecCodes. case need use another grib key locate correct message. Typically indicatorOfParameter grib edition 1, paramId grib edition 2. Looking back output grib_ls , can see message total precipitation (shortName = “tp”) indicatorOfParameter = 61, 10m wind speed (shortName = “ws”) indicatorOfParameter = 32. can therefore use extract data file using use_grib_indicatorOfParameter. practical situations, grib shortName known, user’s responsibility know indicatorOfParameter paramId use.
code: read_grid(   grib_file,   c("total_precipitation", "wind_speed"),   file_format_opts = grib_opts(     param_find = list(       total_precipitation = use_grib_indicatorOfParameter(61),       wind_speed          = use_grib_indicatorOfParameter(32)     )   ) ) #> Reading /home/andrewts/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.3/harpData/grib/AROME_Arctic/2018/07/10/00/fc2018071000+006grib_fp #> <harp_geolist[2]> #> [[1]] <numeric geofield [100 x 100] Min = 0.000 Max = 32.084 Mean = 1.364> #> [[2]] <numeric geofield [100 x 100] Min = 0.801 Max = 21.458 Mean = 9.962>

what: Reading data from specific level types
title: Options for file formats
text: example data file, data exist potential vorticity levels. {harpIO} know read data, can use level_find argument grib_opts() select correct type level. level_find works way param_find requires named list use_grib_*() function set correct grib keys. , typeOfLevel key value “potentialVorticity”, can read geopotential (Z), wind speed x direction model grid (U), wind speed y direction model grid (V) setting typeOfLevel key “potentialVorticity”. Z, U, V parameters {harpIO} knows, don’t need worry param_find. default, levels read, can use second argument use_grib_typeOfLevel set levels read: Note currently warning given levels found. one level asked , least one found function silent missing levels.
code: read_grid(   grib_file,   c("U", "V", "Z"),   file_format_opts = grib_opts(     level_find = list(       U = use_grib_typeOfLevel("potentialVorticity"),       V = use_grib_typeOfLevel("potentialVorticity"),       Z = use_grib_typeOfLevel("potentialVorticity")     )   ),    data_frame = TRUE ) %>%    select(-ends_with("dttm"), -members) #> Reading /home/andrewts/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.3/harpData/grib/AROME_Arctic/2018/07/10/00/fc2018071000+006grib_fp #> # A tibble: 6 × 7 #>   lead_time step_range parameter level_type level units   gridded_data #>       <dbl> <chr>      <chr>     <chr>      <int> <chr>      <geolist> #> 1         6 6          U         unknown     1500 m/s      [100 × 100] #> 2         6 6          U         unknown     2000 m/s      [100 × 100] #> 3         6 6          V         unknown     1500 m/s      [100 × 100] #> 4         6 6          V         unknown     2000 m/s      [100 × 100] #> 5         6 6          Z         unknown     1500 m^2/s^2  [100 × 100] #> 6         6 6          Z         unknown     2000 m^2/s^2  [100 × 100] read_grid(   grib_file,   c("U", "V", "Z"),   file_format_opts = grib_opts(     level_find = list(       U = use_grib_typeOfLevel("potentialVorticity", 1500),       V = use_grib_typeOfLevel("potentialVorticity", 3000),       Z = use_grib_typeOfLevel("potentialVorticity", c(2000, 3000))     )   ),    data_frame = TRUE ) %>%    select(-ends_with("dttm"), -members) #> Reading /home/andrewts/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.3/harpData/grib/AROME_Arctic/2018/07/10/00/fc2018071000+006grib_fp #> Warning: Parameter "V" (shortName: "v", typeOfLevel: "potentialVorticity" for #> level(s) 3000) not found in grib file. #> # A tibble: 2 × 7 #>   lead_time step_range parameter level_type level units   gridded_data #>       <dbl> <chr>      <chr>     <chr>      <int> <chr>      <geolist> #> 1         6 6          U         unknown     1500 m/s      [100 × 100] #> 2         6 6          Z         unknown     2000 m^2/s^2  [100 × 100]

title: Options for file formats
text: Currently read_grid() read_forecast() can either read one vertical levels files. read small selection levels grib file, level_find argument grib_opts() can used conjunction use_grib_pressure(), use_grib_model() use_grib_heightAboveGround() read specific pressure, model (hybrid), height levels. example data contain data range pressure levels, want, example, temperature 850-, 500- 200 hPa, following: Similarly, read temperature 500-, 1000- 1500m ground following: emphasised interpolation done. .e. can use level_find select vertical levels exist file.
code: read_grid(   grib_file,    "T",   file_format_opts = grib_opts(     level_find = list(       T = use_grib_pressure(c(850, 500, 200))     )   ),   data_frame = TRUE ) %>%    select(-ends_with("date"), -members) #> Reading /home/andrewts/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.3/harpData/grib/AROME_Arctic/2018/07/10/00/fc2018071000+006grib_fp #> # A tibble: 3 × 9 #>   fcst_dttm           valid_dttm          lead_time step_range parameter #>   <dttm>              <dttm>                  <dbl> <chr>      <chr>     #> 1 2018-07-10 00:00:00 2018-07-10 06:00:00         6 6          T         #> 2 2018-07-10 00:00:00 2018-07-10 06:00:00         6 6          T         #> 3 2018-07-10 00:00:00 2018-07-10 06:00:00         6 6          T         #> # ℹ 4 more variables: level_type <chr>, level <int>, units <chr>, #> #   gridded_data <geolist> read_grid(   grib_file,    "T",   file_format_opts = grib_opts(     level_find = list(       T = use_grib_heightAboveGround(c(500, 1000, 1500))     )   ),   data_frame = TRUE ) %>%    select(-ends_with("date"), -members) #> Reading /home/andrewts/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.3/harpData/grib/AROME_Arctic/2018/07/10/00/fc2018071000+006grib_fp #> # A tibble: 3 × 9 #>   fcst_dttm           valid_dttm          lead_time step_range parameter #>   <dttm>              <dttm>                  <dbl> <chr>      <chr>     #> 1 2018-07-10 00:00:00 2018-07-10 06:00:00         6 6          T         #> 2 2018-07-10 00:00:00 2018-07-10 06:00:00         6 6          T         #> 3 2018-07-10 00:00:00 2018-07-10 06:00:00         6 6          T         #> # ℹ 4 more variables: level_type <chr>, level <int>, units <chr>, #> #   gridded_data <geolist>

title: Options for file formats
text: Netcdf files becoming increasingly used meteorology climatology. variable netcdf file stored array can subsetted. array file attributes dimensions describe variable. order read data netcdf files using {harpIO} important know something contents files correct variables can read correct subsets taken. done passing list generated netcdf_opts() function read_forecast() read_grid() via file_format_opts argument. netcdf_opts() generates list names dimensions array either find geographic projection information file, projection information proj4 string, whether dimensions reversed. can use netcdf file {harpData} package show netcdf_opts() works. can open connection file using {ncdf4} package get summary contents file. see variables, attributes, dimensions variables global attributes. can use information set correct information using netcdf_opts() want read data using read_forecast(), read_grid(). examples use read_grid(), principles apply read_forecast(). important close connection netcdf file finished (taken care us use read_forecast() read_grid()). Let’s take look default values netcdf_opts()
code: nc_file <- system.file(   "netcdf/AAEPS/fc2018071000.nc",    package = "harpData" ) library(ncdf4) nc <- nc_open(nc_file) nc #> File /home/andrewts/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.3/harpData/netcdf/AAEPS/fc2018071000.nc (NC_FORMAT_NETCDF4_CLASSIC): #>  #>      13 variables (excluding dimension variables): #>         double It has horizontal resolution of 2.5 km, has 65 vertical levels and 10 members. MEPS is ran four times daily (00,06,12,18) with three-hourly cycling for data assimilation. Member 0 and 1 are ran up to 66 hours, the rest up to 48 hours. Boundary data is from ECMWF, and initial perturbations are based on the SLAF method. title: Options for file formats
text: 3 elements list begin proj4_. control projection information obtained. proj4_var name variable netcdf file holds proj4 string. proj4_att name attribute proj4_var proj4 string. set NULL, attempt made read proj4 string directly proj4_var proj4 can set proj4 string directly rather attempt read file. proj4 NULL, proj4_var proj4_att ignored. summary netcdf file , variable projection_lambert attribute proj4, contains proj4 string “+proj=lcc +lat_0=77.5 +lon_0=-25 +lat_1=77.5 +lat_2=77.5 +no_defs +R=6.371e+06”, default values get netcdf_opts() correct file.

title: Options for file formats
text: dimension names variables set using x_dim, y_dim, z_var, member_var time_var. reason need know names arrays netcdf file can stored dimension order, may wish read subset array need know parts dimensions take. default, netcdf_opts() gives us: Since z_var member_var NA, default means expecting find variables netcdf file 3 dimensions: “x”, “y” “time”. go back example , let’s say want read 2m temperature (“air_temperature_2m”, harp parameter “T2m”), see air_temperature_2m 5 dimensions: x, y, ensemble_member, height1 time. therefore need modify values z_var member_var using netcdf_opts():
code: x_dim      = "x" y_dim      = "y" time_var   = "time" z_var      = NA member_var = NA my_nc_opts <- netcdf_opts(z_var = "height1", member_var = "ensemble_member")

title: Options for file formats
text: leaves lon_var, lat_var ref_time_var. file contains arrays longitude latitude, used geographically orientate data - set NULL attempt made using x_dim y_dim projection information. ref_time_var used forecasts calculate lead time. set NA, lead time calculated subtracting first element time dimension subsequent element. can now attempt read data - firstly without using netcdf_opts(): error tells dimension names given - case (time, x, y) - defaults netcdf_opts(), dimensions found file: (ensemble_member, height1, time, x, y). Note warning dimensions listed alphabetical order, us decide dimension go . , now use modified options read file, get result: can also select specific members lead times:
code: read_grid(nc_file, "T2m", data_frame = TRUE) #> Reading /home/andrewts/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.3/harpData/netcdf/AAEPS/fc2018071000.nc #> Warning: No 'format_opts' passed for NetCDF file. Using default netcdf_opts() #> Warning: Requested dimensions do not match for 'T2m' in /home/andrewts/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.3/harpData/netcdf/AAEPS/fc2018071000.nc. #> Requested dimensions: (ensemble_member, time, x, y) #> Dimensions in file: (ensemble_member, height1, time, x, y). #> Error: Cannot read from netcdf file: /home/andrewts/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.3/harpData/netcdf/AAEPS/fc2018071000.nc read_grid(nc_file, "T2m", file_format_opts = my_nc_opts, data_frame = TRUE) %>%    select(-ends_with("dttm")) #> Reading /home/andrewts/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.3/harpData/netcdf/AAEPS/fc2018071000.nc #> # A tibble: 25 × 7 #>    lead_time parameter level_type level units gridded_data   members #>        <dbl> <chr>     <chr>      <dbl> <chr>    <geolist> <int[1d]> #>  1         0 T2m       height         2 K      [100 × 100]         0 #>  2         0 T2m       height         2 K      [100 × 100]         1 #>  3         0 T2m       height         2 K      [100 × 100]         2 #>  4         0 T2m       height         2 K      [100 × 100]         3 #>  5         0 T2m       height         2 K      [100 × 100]         4 #>  6         3 T2m       height         2 K      [100 × 100]         0 #>  7         3 T2m       height         2 K      [100 × 100]         1 #>  8         3 T2m       height         2 K      [100 × 100]         2 #>  9         3 T2m       height         2 K      [100 × 100]         3 #> 10         3 T2m       height         2 K      [100 × 100]         4 #> # title: Options for file formats
text: Finally, netcdf_opts() number default sets options can set via options_set argument. set options known values data sources - currently operational NWP forecasts MET Norway WRF (though isn’t fully tested). options : “met_norway_eps” - EPS forecasts produced MET Norway, “met_norway_det” - deterministic forecasts produced MET Norway “met_norway_ifsens” - IFSENS forecasts ECMWF archived MET Norway “met_norway_ifshires” - IFSHIRES forecasts ECMWF archived MET Norway “wrf” - WRF forecasts WRF “mass” grid “wrf_u_stagger” - WRF forecasts U-staggered grid “wrf_v_stagger” - WRF forecasts V-staggered grid can, example, use “met_norway_det” options set reading data MET Norway thredds server: Note download data external source need explicitly tell read_grid() (read_forecast()) file format “netcdf”. file disk initial scan file done try guess format, possible external files. demonstration purposes using read_forecast()
code: read_grid(   "https://thredds.met.no/thredds/dodsC/aromearcticarchive/2021/03/01/arome_arctic_extracted_2_5km_20210301T21Z.nc",    "T2m",   lead_time        = 6,   file_format      = "netcdf",   file_format_opts = netcdf_opts("met_norway_det") ) #> Reading https://thredds.met.no/thredds/dodsC/aromearcticarchive/2021/03/01/arome_arctic_extracted_2_5km_20210301T21Z.nc #>  : T2m K  #> Time: #>  2021/03/01 21:00 #> Domain summary: #> 739 x 949 domain #> Projection summary: #> proj= lcc  #> NE = ( 68.83323 , 71.10861 ) #> SW = ( -17.957 , 69.299 ) #> Data summary: #> 241.2239 257.6566 267.764 264.93 272.1761 279.136 url      <- "https://thredds.met.no/thredds/dodsC/aromearcticarchive" template <- paste0(   "{YYYY}/{MM}/{DD}/",   "{fcst_model}_extracted_2_5km_{YYYY}{MM}{DD}T{HH}Z.nc" ) read_forecast(   seq_dttm(2021030100, 2021030118, "6h"),   fcst_model       = "arome_arctic",   parameter        = "T2m",   by               = "6h",   lead_time        = seq(0, 3),   file_path        = url,   file_template    = template,   file_format      = "netcdf",   file_format_opts = netcdf_opts("met_norway_det"),   return_data      = TRUE ) %>%    select(-starts_with("level"), -fcst_cycle ,-valid_dttm) #> Reading https://thredds.met.no/thredds/dodsC/aromearcticarchive/2021/03/01/arome_arctic_extracted_2_5km_20210301T00Z.nc #> Reading https://thredds.met.no/thredds/dodsC/aromearcticarchive/2021/03/01/arome_arctic_extracted_2_5km_20210301T06Z.nc #> Reading https://thredds.met.no/thredds/dodsC/aromearcticarchive/2021/03/01/arome_arctic_extracted_2_5km_20210301T12Z.nc #> Reading https://thredds.met.no/thredds/dodsC/aromearcticarchive/2021/03/01/arome_arctic_extracted_2_5km_20210301T18Z.nc #> ::deterministic gridded forecast:: # A tibble: 16 × 6 #>    fcst_model   fcst_dttm           lead_time parameter units        fcst #>    <chr>        <dttm>                  <dbl> <chr>     <chr>   <geolist> #>  1 arome_arctic 2021-03-01 00:00:00         0 T2m       K     [739 × 949] #>  2 arome_arctic 2021-03-01 00:00:00         1 T2m       K     [739 × 949] #>  3 arome_arctic 2021-03-01 00:00:00         2 T2m       K     [739 × 949] #>  4 arome_arctic 2021-03-01 00:00:00         3 T2m       K     [739 × 949] #>  5 arome_arctic 2021-03-01 06:00:00         0 T2m       K     [739 × 949] #>  6 arome_arctic 2021-03-01 06:00:00         1 T2m       K     [739 × 949] #>  7 arome_arctic 2021-03-01 06:00:00         2 T2m       K     [739 × 949] #>  8 arome_arctic 2021-03-01 06:00:00         3 T2m       K     [739 × 949] #>  9 arome_arctic 2021-03-01 12:00:00         0 T2m       K     [739 × 949] #> 10 arome_arctic 2021-03-01 12:00:00         1 T2m       K     [739 × 949] #> 11 arome_arctic 2021-03-01 12:00:00         2 T2m       K     [739 × 949] #> 12 arome_arctic 2021-03-01 12:00:00         3 T2m       K     [739 × 949] #> 13 arome_arctic 2021-03-01 18:00:00         0 T2m       K     [739 × 949] #> 14 arome_arctic 2021-03-01 18:00:00         1 T2m       K     [739 × 949] #> 15 arome_arctic 2021-03-01 18:00:00         2 T2m       K     [739 × 949] #> 16 arome_arctic 2021-03-01 18:00:00         3 T2m       K     [739 × 949]

title: Options for file formats
text: Netcdf files typically contain many variables, meteorological data can range vertical coordinates - e.g. height, pressure, model levels etc. although set options netcdf_opts() don’t want set everything every variable wish read file. address , function modify_opts() can used change one options. try read “specific_humidity_ml” example file netcdf options currently , get error z_var = “height1”, variable needs “hybrid”: , change z_var “hybrid” use modify_opts(): also pass vertical_coordinate = "model" get correct name level_type column data frame output. Note variables singleton z dimension, name can given z_var long exists dimension file. Furthermore, many different dimensions names “height0”, “height1”, “height2” etc. number doesn’t match. means modify z_var much.
code: read_grid(   nc_file,    "specific_humidity_ml",    lead_time        = 3,   file_format_opts = my_nc_opts,    data_frame       = TRUE ) #> Reading /home/andrewts/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.3/harpData/netcdf/AAEPS/fc2018071000.nc #> # A tibble: 325 × 9 #>    fcst_dttm           valid_dttm          lead_time parameter        level_type #>    <dttm>              <dttm>                  <dbl> <chr>            <chr>      #>  1 2018-07-10 00:00:00 2018-07-10 03:00:00         3 specific_humidi… pressure   #>  2 2018-07-10 00:00:00 2018-07-10 03:00:00         3 specific_humidi… pressure   #>  3 2018-07-10 00:00:00 2018-07-10 03:00:00         3 specific_humidi… pressure   #>  4 2018-07-10 00:00:00 2018-07-10 03:00:00         3 specific_humidi… pressure   #>  5 2018-07-10 00:00:00 2018-07-10 03:00:00         3 specific_humidi… pressure   #>  6 2018-07-10 00:00:00 2018-07-10 03:00:00         3 specific_humidi… pressure   #>  7 2018-07-10 00:00:00 2018-07-10 03:00:00         3 specific_humidi… pressure   #>  8 2018-07-10 00:00:00 2018-07-10 03:00:00         3 specific_humidi… pressure   #>  9 2018-07-10 00:00:00 2018-07-10 03:00:00         3 specific_humidi… pressure   #> 10 2018-07-10 00:00:00 2018-07-10 03:00:00         3 specific_humidi… pressure   #> # ℹ 315 more rows #> # ℹ 4 more variables: level <dbl>, units <chr>, gridded_data <geolist>, #> #   members <int[1d]> read_grid(   nc_file,    "specific_humidity_ml",   lead_time            = 3,   file_format_opts     = modify_opts(my_nc_opts, z_var = "hybrid"),   data_frame           = TRUE,   vertical_coordinate = "model" ) %>%    select(-ends_with("dttm")) #> Reading /home/andrewts/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.3/harpData/netcdf/AAEPS/fc2018071000.nc #> # title: Reading forecast model data
text: examples use data provided harpData package, , haven’t done already, can install :
code: remotes::install_github("harphub/harpData")

title: Reading forecast model data
text: simplest application read_forecast() read deterministic forecasts. minimum, start date, end date, name forecast model (fcst_model) parameter read needed arguments. data use grib files AROME-Arctic model come harpData. default function looks current working directory files “vfld” template (see show_file_templates()). Therefore, need also pass file_path file_template arguments. Finally, default behaviour read_forecast() return data - one main roles write data output files another format volumes data involved easily become large hold memory - also set return_data = TRUE. last column data frame, named AROME_Arctic_det forecast data, stored geofield objects - simply 2d arrays attributes describe projection, time parameter information data. deterministic models name column forecast model name suffix “_det”.
code: library(harpIO) #> Loading required package: harpCore #>  #> Attaching package: 'harpCore' #> The following object is masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter read_forecast(   2018071000,   "AROME_Arctic",   "T2m",   file_path     = system.file("grib/AROME_Arctic", package = "harpData"),   file_template = "harmonie_grib_fp",   return_data   = TRUE ) #> ::deterministic gridded forecast:: # A tibble: 17 × 11 #>    fcst_model   fcst_dttm           lead_time parameter valid_dttm          #>    <chr>        <dttm>                  <dbl> <chr>     <dttm>              #>  1 AROME_Arctic 2018-07-10 00:00:00         0 T2m       2018-07-10 00:00:00 #>  2 AROME_Arctic 2018-07-10 00:00:00         3 T2m       2018-07-10 03:00:00 #>  3 AROME_Arctic 2018-07-10 00:00:00         6 T2m       2018-07-10 06:00:00 #>  4 AROME_Arctic 2018-07-10 00:00:00         9 T2m       2018-07-10 09:00:00 #>  5 AROME_Arctic 2018-07-10 00:00:00        12 T2m       2018-07-10 12:00:00 #>  6 AROME_Arctic 2018-07-10 00:00:00        15 T2m       2018-07-10 15:00:00 #>  7 AROME_Arctic 2018-07-10 00:00:00        18 T2m       2018-07-10 18:00:00 #>  8 AROME_Arctic 2018-07-10 00:00:00        21 T2m       2018-07-10 21:00:00 #>  9 AROME_Arctic 2018-07-10 00:00:00        24 T2m       2018-07-11 00:00:00 #> 10 AROME_Arctic 2018-07-10 00:00:00        27 T2m       2018-07-11 03:00:00 #> # ℹ 7 more rows #> # ℹ 6 more variables: step_range <chr>, level_type <chr>, level <int>, #> #   units <chr>, fcst_cycle <chr>, fcst <geolist>

title: Reading forecast model data
text: Reading ensemble forecasts works exactly way. harpData includes output AROME-Arctic ensemble model, AAEPS, dates , time stored single netcdf file. Since data netcdf file, netcdf files can use many different dimension names variable names, read_forecast() needs information structure netcdf file. structure information generated function netcdf_opts(), since data come EPS model produced MET Norway can use one built options sets: netcdf_opts(options_set = "met_norway_eps"). lead times ensemble members file, want read members file don’t pass members argument. see warning missing lead times. default behaviour ask lead times 0 - 48 hours, every three hours. forecast data columns name forecast model suffix “_mbrXXX” XXX member number. also ask limited set lead times ensemble members:
code: read_forecast(   2018071000,   "AAEPS",   "T2m",   file_path        = system.file("netcdf/AAEPS", package = "harpData"),   file_template    = "fc{YYYY}{MM}{DD}{HH}.nc",   file_format_opts = netcdf_opts(options_set = "met_norway_eps"),   return_data      = TRUE ) #> ::ensemble gridded forecast:: # A tibble: 5 × 14 #>   fcst_model fcst_dttm           lead_time parameter valid_dttm          #>   <chr>      <dttm>                  <dbl> <chr>     <dttm>              #> 1 AAEPS      2018-07-10 00:00:00         0 T2m       2018-07-10 00:00:00 #> 2 AAEPS      2018-07-10 00:00:00         3 T2m       2018-07-10 03:00:00 #> 3 AAEPS      2018-07-10 00:00:00         6 T2m       2018-07-10 06:00:00 #> 4 AAEPS      2018-07-10 00:00:00         9 T2m       2018-07-10 09:00:00 #> 5 AAEPS      2018-07-10 00:00:00        12 T2m       2018-07-10 12:00:00 #> # title: Reading forecast model data
text: lagged ensembles, data available harpData CMEPS model vfld format. vfld files text files gridded data already interpolated points. CMEPS ensemble quite complex number members available hour, tied control member every three hours. harpData members 0, 1, 3, 4, 5 6 members 0 1 run hours 0, 3, 6, …, 21; members 3 4 hours 1, 4, 7, …, 22; members 5 6 hours 2, 5, 8, …, 23. means members 3 4 two hours behind members 0 1, members 5 6 one hour behind members 0 1. lags argument used pass lagging information read_forecast lags aer assumed order members argument. Note also dates CMEPS data different ones used . see number members NA - certain combinations forecast time lead time exist members. data read SQLite files using read_point_forecast() information adjusted take care lagged members. working point data, efficient workflow use read_forecast() write data files read files.
code: read_forecast(   seq_dttm(2019021700, 2019021718, "6h"),   "CMEPS_prod",   "T2m",   lead_time     = seq(0, 12, 3),   members       = c(0, 1, 3, 4, 5, 6),   lags          = c(0, 0, 2, 2, 1, 1),   file_path     = system.file("vfld", package = "harpData"),   file_template = "vfld_eps",   return_data   = TRUE  ) #> ::ensemble point forecast:: # A tibble: 22,980 × 16 #>    fcst_model fcst_dttm           lead_time parameter   SID   lat   lon units #>    <chr>      <dttm>                  <dbl> <chr>     <int> <dbl> <dbl> <chr> #>  1 CMEPS_prod 2019-02-17 00:00:00         0 T2m        1001  70.9 -8.67 K     #>  2 CMEPS_prod 2019-02-17 00:00:00         0 T2m        1010  69.3 16.1  K     #>  3 CMEPS_prod 2019-02-17 00:00:00         0 T2m        1014  69.2 17.9  K     #>  4 CMEPS_prod 2019-02-17 00:00:00         0 T2m        1015  69.6 17.8  K     #>  5 CMEPS_prod 2019-02-17 00:00:00         0 T2m        1018  69.2 16.0  K     #>  6 CMEPS_prod 2019-02-17 00:00:00         0 T2m        1023  69.1 18.5  K     #>  7 CMEPS_prod 2019-02-17 00:00:00         0 T2m        1025  69.7 18.9  K     #>  8 CMEPS_prod 2019-02-17 00:00:00         0 T2m        1026  69.7 18.9  K     #>  9 CMEPS_prod 2019-02-17 00:00:00         0 T2m        1027  69.7 18.9  K     #> 10 CMEPS_prod 2019-02-17 00:00:00         0 T2m        1033  70.2 19.5  K     #> # ℹ 22,970 more rows #> # ℹ 8 more variables: valid_dttm <dttm>, fcst_cycle <chr>, #> #   CMEPS_prod_mbr000 <dbl>, CMEPS_prod_mbr001 <dbl>, #> #   CMEPS_prod_mbr003_lag2h <dbl>, CMEPS_prod_mbr004_lag2h <dbl>, #> #   CMEPS_prod_mbr005_lag1h <dbl>, CMEPS_prod_mbr006_lag1h <dbl>

title: Transforming forecast model data
text: interpolate forecast data points, set transformation = "interpolate" call read_forecast(). harp built list weather stations, station_list, taken list WMO SYNOP stations 2018. default interpolate stations exist within forecast model domain. example, AROME_Arctic data interpolated stations within domain. First attach harpIO package (equally attach harp, automatically attaches harp packages) going read AROME_Arctic data 10m wind speed (S10m) adding transformation = "interpolate" see warning couple messages. warning states read_forecast() receive options interpolation using default options default station list. Furthermore, see interpolate weights derived ‘sfc_geo’ - default behaviour corrections made 2m temperature elevation differences model reality.
code: library(harpIO) #> Loading required package: harpCore #>  #> Attaching package: 'harpCore' #> The following object is masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter read_forecast(   2018071000,   "AROME_Arctic",   "S10m",   transformation = "interpolate",   file_path      = system.file("grib/AROME_Arctic", package = "harpData"),   file_template  = "harmonie_grib_fp",   return_data    = TRUE ) #> Warning: 'transformation_opts' not set for transformation = 'interpolate'. #> Using default interpolate_opts() #> ::deterministic point forecast:: # A tibble: 119 × 14 #>    fcst_model   fcst_dttm           lead_time parameter valid_dttm          #>    <chr>        <dttm>                  <dbl> <chr>     <dttm>              #>  1 AROME_Arctic 2018-07-10 00:00:00         0 S10m      2018-07-10 00:00:00 #>  2 AROME_Arctic 2018-07-10 00:00:00         0 S10m      2018-07-10 00:00:00 #>  3 AROME_Arctic 2018-07-10 00:00:00         0 S10m      2018-07-10 00:00:00 #>  4 AROME_Arctic 2018-07-10 00:00:00         0 S10m      2018-07-10 00:00:00 #>  5 AROME_Arctic 2018-07-10 00:00:00         0 S10m      2018-07-10 00:00:00 #>  6 AROME_Arctic 2018-07-10 00:00:00         0 S10m      2018-07-10 00:00:00 #>  7 AROME_Arctic 2018-07-10 00:00:00         0 S10m      2018-07-10 00:00:00 #>  8 AROME_Arctic 2018-07-10 00:00:00         3 S10m      2018-07-10 03:00:00 #>  9 AROME_Arctic 2018-07-10 00:00:00         3 S10m      2018-07-10 03:00:00 #> 10 AROME_Arctic 2018-07-10 00:00:00         3 S10m      2018-07-10 03:00:00 #> # ℹ 109 more rows #> # ℹ 9 more variables: step_range <chr>, level_type <chr>, level <int>, #> #   units <chr>, SID <int>, lat <dbl>, lon <dbl>, fcst_cycle <chr>, fcst <dbl>

title: Transforming forecast model data
text: Options interpolation set using interpolate_opts() function passed read_forecast() via transformation_opts argument. can see options available defaults running interpolate_opts can use interpolate_opts() set points want interpolate, setting stations data frame (use default station_list, normally read external source rather set manually). important data frame includes columns “SID”, “lat”, “lon” , optionally, “elev”, “SID” unique station ID “elev” elevation station meters. see warning “elev” column found correct_t2m set FALSE. interpolating 2m temperature attempt made make correction due difference height model reality using simple lapse rate can changed default 0.0065 K/m lapse_rate argument. station elevation available, done. Furthermore, 2m correction done, uncorrected model temperature discarded, can kept setting keep_model_2m = TRUE. Finally, first forecast file contain surface geopotential, model orography “clim file” can passed contain information grid forecast files. Additionally parameter read clim file can set - normally “sfc_geo” “oro”. demonstrate , let’s add “elev” column (fake data) small station list read 2m temperature keeping uncorrected model 2m temperature manually setting clim file. show effect correction 2m temperature, can just show relevant columns using select method dplyr package, bringing T2m T2m_uncorrected columns using pivot_wider() function tidyr package. see uncorrected temperatures higher set artificially high elevations elevation my_stations.
code: interpolate_opts() #> No stations specified. Using default stations: 'station_list' #> $stations #> # A tibble: 13,417 × 5 #>      SID   lat   lon  elev name          #>    <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <chr>         #>  1  1001  70.9 -8.67   9.4 JAN MAYEN     #>  2  1002  80.1 16.2    8   VERLEGENHUKEN #>  3  1003  77   15.5   11.1 HORNSUND      #>  4  1004  78.9 11.9    8   NY-ALESUND II #>  5  1006  78.3 22.8   14   EDGEOYA       #>  6  1007  78.9 11.9    7.7 NY-ALESUND    #>  7  1008  78.2 15.5   26.8 SVALBARD AP   #>  8  1009  80.7 25.0    5   KARL XII OYA  #>  9  1010  69.3 16.1   13.1 ANDOYA        #> 10  1011  80.1 31.5   10   KVITOYA       #> # ℹ 13,407 more rows #>  #> $method #> [1] "nearest" #>  #> $correct_t2m #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $keep_model_t2m #> [1] FALSE #>  #> $lapse_rate #> [1] 0.0065 #>  #> $clim_file #> NULL #>  #> $clim_file_format #> NULL #>  #> $clim_file_opts #> NULL #>  #> $clim_param #> [1] "sfc_geo" #>  #> $use_mask #> [1] FALSE #>  #> $weights #> NULL #>  #> $keep_raw_data #> [1] FALSE my_stations <- data.frame(   SID = c(1003, 1004, 1006),   lat = c(77.0000, 78.9167, 78.2506),   lon = c(15.5000, 11.9331, 22.8225) ) my_options <- interpolate_opts(stations = my_stations) #> Warning: No 'elev' column found in stations, and correct_t2m = TRUE. Setting #> correct_t2m = FALSE my_stations$elev <- c(145, 233, 308)  my_options <- interpolate_opts(   stations       = my_stations,   keep_model_t2m = TRUE,   clim_file      = system.file(     "grib/AROME_Arctic/2018/07/10/00/fc2018071000+048grib_fp",      package = "harpData"   ) )  t2m <- read_forecast(   2018071000,   "AROME_Arctic",   "T2m",   transformation      = "interpolate",   transformation_opts = my_options,   file_path           = system.file("grib/AROME_Arctic", package = "harpData"),   file_template       = "harmonie_grib_fp",   return_data         = TRUE ) library(dplyr) library(tidyr) select(t2m, SID, lead_time, parameter, fcst) %>%   pivot_wider(names_from = parameter, values_from = fcst) #> # A tibble: 51 × 4 #>      SID lead_time T2m_uncorrected   T2m #>    <dbl>     <dbl>           <dbl> <dbl> #>  1  1003         0            277.  276. #>  2  1004         0            277.  276. #>  3  1006         0            278.  276. #>  4  1003         3            277.  277. #>  5  1004         3            276.  276. #>  6  1006         3            278.  276. #>  7  1003         6            277.  277. #>  8  1004         6            276.  276. #>  9  1006         6            278.  276. #> 10  1003         9            277.  277. #> # ℹ 41 more rows

title: Transforming forecast model data
text: Regridding done much way interpolating points, except set transformation = "regrid" options generated using regrid_opts(). Unlike interpolation transformation_opts must set read_forecast() won’t know grid regrid data. important argument regrid_opts() new_domain. defines domain data regridded. must “geofield” “geodomain” object - gridded data read read_forecast() read_grid() automatically coerced geofields, geodomain can defined using harpCore’s define_domain() function. demonstrate regridding making domain 10km resolution based AROME_Arctic domain. , keep_raw_data = TRUE, means original fields regridded fields kept can compare . keep_raw_data set, original data regridding discarded. can now plot two fields using plot_field() harpVis package.
code: library(meteogrid)  my_domain <- define_domain(   centre_lon = 15.57905,   centre_lat = 78.21638,   nxny    = 15,   dxdy    = 10000,   reflat  = 77.5,   reflon  = -25 )  my_options <- regrid_opts(new_domain = my_domain, keep_raw_data = TRUE) s10m <- read_forecast(   2018071000,   "AROME_Arctic",   "S10m",   transformation      = "regrid",   transformation_opts = my_options,   file_path           = system.file("grib/AROME_Arctic", package = "harpData"),   file_template       = "harmonie_grib_fp",   return_data         = TRUE ) library(harpVis) #> Loading required package: ggplot2 #> Loading required package: shiny plot_field(    s10m,     fcst_model = "AROME_Arctic",     plot_col   = gridded_data,     lead_time  = 0,     breaks     = seq(0, 20, 2)  ) #   plot_field(    s10m,     fcst_model = "AROME_Arctic",     plot_col   = regridded_data,     lead_time  = 0,     breaks     = seq(0, 20, 2)  )

title: IO functions and data wrangling for harp
text: {harpIO} provides set read write functions harp plus option transform gridded data point data, cross sections grids read time. {harpIO} able read grib1, grib2, FA, NetCDF vfld files weather forecast / climate models; station observations vobs files, radar / satellite observations HDF5 files future -house databases selected meteorological institutes. formats require support packages installed given advice packages install attempt read data.

title: IO functions and data wrangling for harp
code: install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("harphub/harpIO")

title: IO functions and data wrangling for harp
text: {harpIO} uses {meteogrid} package interpolation geogrid class storing gridded data. package makes use PROJ4 library handling projections. PROJ4 installed can install : sudo rights, speak system administrator. PROJ libraries installed standard location (e.g. /usr/local) meteogrid install without problems. However, PROJ libraries non standard location, need tell install function : Alternatively can set environment variables include environment variables .bashrc file, equivalent, won’t need worry wish install update meteogrid. can set compiler linker options file $HOME/.R/Makevars case set worry wish install update meteogrid… However, danger setting Makevars explicitly can impact installation packages, general good practice remove rename $HOME/.R/Makevars successful installation. setting environment variables creating Makevars file, R must restarted changes take effect running remotes::install_github("harphub/harpIO").
code: sudo apt-get install libproj-dev remotes::install_github(   "harphub/harpIO",   configure.args = c(     meteogrid = "--with-proj-lib=/path/to/proj/lib --with-proj-include=/path/to/proj/include"   ) ) export PROJ_LIB_PATH=/path/to/proj/lib export PROJ_INCLUDE_PATH=/path/to/proj/include CPPFLAGS=-I/path/to/proj/include LDFLAGS=-L/path/to/proj/lib -Wl,-rpath,/path/to/proj/lib

title: IO functions and data wrangling for harp
text: main workhorse {harpIO} read_forecast(). function can read multiple files multiple sources gridded point data. See articles Reading forcast model data Options file formats information. gridded data option transform data point data, another grid, vertical cross section. done transformation transformation_opts arguments. Interpolation points done providing data frame latitiude longitude locations, regridding done providing definition grid regrid (necessary reproject) data, cross section obtained providing latitude longitude end points reading 3 dimensional data. See article Transforming forecast model data information. data interpolated points possible save result SQLite files. portable database files allow fast access data ability select filter wish read. can tell read_forecast() output point data SQLite files setting argument output_file_opts = sqlite_opts(path = "/path//output"). data can read read_point_forecast(). gridded data generally advantage outputting another format, option available data either point data begin , transformation = "interpolate".

title: IO functions and data wrangling for harp
text: point observations, {harpIO} can currently read vobs files, produced HIRLAM consortium, write SQLite files using read_obs() faster access. SQLite files can read read_point_obs(). gridded observations, data can read NetCDF, grib HDF5 files using read_grid() (note need install “ncdf4” package CRAN read NetCDF files, need install “Rgrib2” package remotes::install_github("harphub/Rgrib2") read grib files need install “hdf5r” package CRAN read HDF5 files).

title: IO functions and data wrangling for harp
text: hdf5r package needed read HDF5 files. Installation package requires HDF5 system library. library available e.g. /usr/local/lib /usr/lib similar location HDF5 library needs specified. Typically can done However, cases appropriate link flags might set properly. case temporarily create ~/.R/Makevars file following content: install hdf5r remove ~/.R/Makevars file. ECMWF Atos platform can put following ~/.R/Makevars
code: install.packages(   "hdf5r",   configure.args = "--with-hdf5=/path/to/hdf5" ) PKG_LIBS = -L/path/to/hdf5/lib -Wl,-rpath,/path/to/hdf5/lib -lhdf5hl_fortran -lhdf5_hl_cpp -lhdf5_hl -lhdf5_fortran -lhdf5_cpp -lhdf5 -lm PKG_LIBS = $(HDF5_LIB) module load hdf5 module load R R > install.packages("hdf5r") > file.remove("~/.R/Makevars")

text: name name parameter file. case grib files, grib shortName case obsoul files, number used define variable . addition, can expressed character vector grib files order try different shortNames paramatet found. named list function applied names matching argument names function. level_type grib levelType. Can character vector order try different levelTypes variable found file. default named list using built grib_level_types define names diffferent vertical coordinate systems. level level number. Set -999 levels. suffix suffix add name different vertical coordinate systems. units units parameter vfld / vobs files. name_len number characters name FA files. 16 default adds blank spaces end name make required length. harp_param name parameter used outputs read functions. type type parmater - either "SYNOP" "TEMP"

what: Generate filenames from a template and arguments — generate_filenames
title: Generate filenames from a template and arguments — generate_filenames
text: flexible replacement get_filenames function. main difference allows pass argument might exist substituted file name. arguments passed ...

title: Generate filenames from a template and arguments — generate_filenames
code: generate_filenames(   file_path = getwd(),   file_date = Sys.Date(),   start_date = NULL,   end_date = NULL,   by = "6h",   lags = "0s",   file_template = "fctable",   filenames_only = TRUE,   ... )

title: Generate filenames from a template and arguments — generate_filenames
text: file_path parent path file names. file names generated file_path directory. default current working directory. file_date Forecast date file names. Can YYYYMMDD, YYYYMMDDhh, YYYYMMDDhhmm, YYYYMMDDhhmmss format. Can numeric charcter. passed system time YYYYMMDD format used. start_date Date first forecast file names. Can YYYYMMDD, YYYYMMDDhh, YYYYMMDDhhmm, YYYYMMDDhhmmss format. Can numeric charcter. NULL, file_date must specified. NULL, end_date must also specified. end_date Date last forecast file names. Can YYYYMMDD, YYYYMMDDhh, YYYYMMDDhhmm, YYYYMMDDhhmmss format. Can numeric charcter. Used conjunction start_date . time new forecasts. numeric, assumed hours, time units may given letter number d = days, h = hours, m = minutes s = seconds. sequence forecasts dates generated start_date end_date every . lags named list members ensemble forecast model lagged amount lagged. list names names forecast models, given fcst_model lagged members, lags given vectors length members vector. lags numeric, assumed hours, units may specified letter value d = days, h = hours, m = minutes s = seconds. lags primarily used generate correct file names lagged members - example lag 1 hour generate file name date-time 1 hour earlier date-time sequence (start_data, end_date,   = ) lead time 1 hour longer. file_template template file names. available built templates see show_file_templates. anything else passed, returned unmodified, substitutions made dynamic values. Available substitutions YYYY year, {MM} 2 digit month leading zero, {M} month leading zero, similarly {DD} {D} day, {HH} {H} hour, {mm} {m} minute. Also {LDTx} lead time {MBRx} x length string including leading zeros. Note full path file always file_path/template. filenames_only Logical. TRUE (default), vector file names returned, otherwise FALSE data frame returned metadata used generated file names included. ... arguments substitutions file_template. Note ensemble members, members may used {MBRx} substitution.

title: Generate filenames from a template and arguments — generate_filenames
text: character vector data frame.

what: Convert a Geofield to a Raster — geofield_to_raster
title: Convert a Geofield to a Raster — geofield_to_raster
text: wish work raster package, can convert geofield objects raster using function.

title: Convert a Geofield to a Raster — geofield_to_raster
code: geofield_to_raster(x)  raster_to_geofield(x)

title: Convert a Geofield to a Raster — geofield_to_raster
text: x geofield geofield_to_raster, raster raster_to_geofield.

title: Convert a Geofield to a Raster — geofield_to_raster
text: raster geofield_to_raster, geofield raster_to_geofield.

title: Convert a Geofield to a Raster — geofield_to_raster
code: if (   requireNamespace("Rgrib2", quietly = TRUE) &   requireNamespace("harpData", quietly = TRUE) ) {   geo <- read_grid(     system.file(       "grib/AROME_Arctic/2018/07/10/00/fc2018071000+000grib_fp",       package = "harpData"     ),     "T2m"   )    meteogrid::iview(geo, legend = TRUE)   ras <- geofield_to_raster(geo)   if (require("raster")) {     plot(ras)   }    geo1 <- raster_to_geofield(ras)   meteogrid::iview(geo1, legend = TRUE) } #> Reading /home/andrewts/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.3/harpData/grib/AROME_Arctic/2018/07/10/00/fc2018071000+000grib_fp #> The legacy packages maptools, rgdal, and rgeos, underpinning this package #> will retire shortly. Please refer to R-spatial evolution reports on #> https://r-spatial.org/r/2023/05/15/evolution4.html for details. #> This package is now running under evolution status 0  #> Loading required package: raster #> Loading required package: sp #>  #> Attaching package: ‘raster’ #> The following object is masked from ‘package:harpCore’: #>  #>     bind

title: FA parameter names — get_fa_param_info
text: harp-style parameter translated field name ALARO/AROME/HARMONIE model output FA format

title: FA parameter names — get_fa_param_info
code: get_fa_param_info(   param,   fa_type = "arome",   fa_vector = TRUE,   rotate_wind = FALSE )

title: FA parameter names — get_fa_param_info
text: param Parameter name fa_type 'alaro' 'arome'. models store e.g. precipitation different name. fa_vector logical value. TRUE means e.g. wind speed calculated wind vector components, searched separate field. rotate_wind TRUE, wind fields (U, V, direction) rotated model axes earth axes.

title: FA parameter names — get_fa_param_info
text: 16 character string, rare cases vector several strings denoting components (e.g. total precipitation may sum 4 fields).

what: Get filename(s) for meteorological data — get_filenames
title: Get filename(s) for meteorological data — get_filenames
text: function deprecated generate_filenames superior.

title: Get filename(s) for meteorological data — get_filenames
code: get_filenames(   file_path = getwd(),   file_date = Sys.Date(),   start_date = NULL,   end_date = NULL,   by = "6h",   lags = NULL,   parameter = NULL,   det_model = NULL,   eps_model = NULL,   sub_model = NULL,   lead_time = seq(0, 48, 3),   members = NA_character_,   file_template = "fctable_eps",   filenames_only = TRUE,   ... )

title: Get filename(s) for meteorological data — get_filenames
text: file_path static path data. file_date single date - may YYYYMMDD, YYYYMMDDHH, YYYYMMDDHHmm. specified start_date specified system date used time 00:00. start_date specified assumed range dates requested end_date must also specified. range given start_date end_date frequency given . start_date passed file_date ignored. format file_date. end_date end date range. format file_date. frequency date range. string number followed letter, letter gives units - may d days, h hours m minutes. lags reading files lagged forecast members run different times, lag times set . times expressed character vector, number followed letter giving units. avialable units d, h, m, s days, hours, minutes seconds. {MBRx} template, must length members. parameter {parameter} exists template must specified. det_model {det_model} exists template must specified. eps_model {eps_model} exists template must specified. sub_model {sub_model} exists template must specified. lead_time lead times included file names {LDTx} template. Given vector numbers. members members included file names {MBRx} template file_template file type generate template . Can build templates show_file_templates. anything else passed, returned unmodified. case substitutions can used. Available substitutions YYYY year, {MM} 2 digit month leading zero, {M} month leading zero, similarly {DD} {D} day, {HH} {H} hour, {mm} {m} minute. Also {LDTx} lead time {MBRx} ensemble member x length string including leading zeros - can omitted 2, 3 4. Note full path file always file_path/template. filenames_only Logical. Set TRUE return vector unique file names. Set FALSE return detailed data frame. ... used

title: Get filename(s) for meteorological data — get_filenames
text: filenames_only TRUE, vector unique file names. filenames_only FALSE, tibble columns eps_model, sub_model, fcdate, file_name, lead_time member.

title: Get filename(s) for meteorological data — get_filenames

what: Set options for grib files — grib_opts
title: Set options for grib files — grib_opts
text: general options grib files need explicitly set. However, wish explicit find field grib file make use param_find argument. pass named list parameters given e.g. read_forecast read_grid wish explicit names. helper functions use_grib_* can used set key value pairs use search.

title: Set options for grib files — grib_opts
code: grib_opts(   meta = TRUE,   multi = FALSE,   param_find = NULL,   level_find = NULL,   step_find = NULL,   ... )  use_grib_key(key, value)  use_grib_indicatorOfParameter(value)  use_grib_parameterNumber(value)  use_grib_paramId(value)  use_grib_shortName(value)  use_grib_key_level(key, value, level = -999)  use_grib_indicatorOfTypeOfLevel(value, level = -999)  use_grib_typeOfLevel(value, level = -999)  use_grib_heightAboveGround(level = -999)  use_grib_pressure(level = -999)  use_grib_hybrid(level = -999)  use_grib_model(level = -999)  use_grib_surface()  use_grib_meanSea()  use_grib_stepRange(value)

title: Set options for grib files — grib_opts
text: meta Logical. Whether read metadata multi Logical. Whether multi field grib messages. param_find named list names parameters find grib files. element named list list names "key" "value". default NULL, means attempt automatically find parameter using shortName appropriate grib table. level_find named list names parameters find grib files. element named list list names "key", "value" "level". "key" grib key used find level, "value" value grib key "level" value level. Set level = -999 select available levels. default NULL, means attempt automatically find level. step_find named list names parameters find grib files. element named list list names "key", "value" "level". "key" grib key used find step, "value" value grib key. step_find typically used find filter data stepRange grib key - helper function use_grib_stepRange() automatically use stepRange key. ... options may exist future Rgrib2 versions. key grib key value value grib key use level grib level use.

title: Set options for grib files — grib_opts
text: list options reading grib files.

title: Set options for grib files — grib_opts
text: harp aware grib shortName field wish read, harp wrong shortName can set param_find using use_grib_shortName(). Alternatively field wish read shortName, value indicatorOfParameter can set param_find using use_grib_indicatorOfParameter(), applies paramId using use_grib_paramId(). can use grib key value pairs find fields grib file setting param_find use_grib_key giving key value search . Finally, element param_find can simply set using list names "key" "value". Similarly, although harp knows type vertical level parameters , may need set explicitly level_find argument list selects grib key use find type level, value grib key corresponds desired type level value level . param_find, helper functions help set desired values level_find. can use use_grib_key_level set grib key, value level explicitly; use_grib_typeOfLevel use typeOfLevel grib key explicitly set value level, similarly use_grib_indicatorOfTypeOfLevel; use_grib_heightAboveGround, use_grib_pressure, use_grib_hybrid set height, pressure hybrid level respectively; use_grib_surface use_grib_meanSea select surface mean sea levels respectively.

title: Set options for grib files — grib_opts
code: grib_opts() #> $meta #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $multi #> [1] FALSE #>  #> $param_find #> NULL #>  #> $level_find #> NULL #>  #> $step_find #> NULL #>  grib_opts(param_find = list(S10m = list(key = "shortName", value = "WS10"))) #> $meta #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $multi #> [1] FALSE #>  #> $param_find #> $param_find$S10m #> $param_find$S10m$key #> [1] "shortName" #>  #> $param_find$S10m$value #> [1] "WS10" #>  #>  #>  #> $level_find #> NULL #>  #> $step_find #> NULL #>  grib_opts(param_find = list(S10m = use_grib_key("shortName", "WS10"))) #> $meta #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $multi #> [1] FALSE #>  #> $param_find #> $param_find$S10m #> $param_find$S10m$key #> [1] "shortName" #>  #> $param_find$S10m$value #> [1] "WS10" #>  #>  #>  #> $level_find #> NULL #>  #> $step_find #> NULL #>  grib_opts(param_find = list(S10m = use_grib_shortName("WS10"))) #> $meta #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $multi #> [1] FALSE #>  #> $param_find #> $param_find$S10m #> $param_find$S10m$key #> [1] "shortName" #>  #> $param_find$S10m$value #> [1] "WS10" #>  #>  #>  #> $level_find #> NULL #>  #> $step_find #> NULL #>  grib_opts(   param_find = list(T2m = use_grib_shortName("t")),   level_find = list(T2m = use_grib_typeOfLevel("heightAboveGround", 2)) ) #> $meta #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $multi #> [1] FALSE #>  #> $param_find #> $param_find$T2m #> $param_find$T2m$key #> [1] "shortName" #>  #> $level_find$T2m$level #> [1] 2 #>  #>  #>  #> $step_find #> NULL #>  use_grib_key("indicatorOfParameter", 65) #> $key #> [1] "indicatorOfParameter" #>  #> $value #> [1] 65 #>  use_grib_indicatorOfParameter(65) #> $key #> [1] "indicatorOfParameter" #>  #> $value #> [1] 65 #>  use_grib_key("paramId", 33) #> $key #> [1] "paramId" #>  #> $value #> [1] 33 #> [1] "shortName" #>  #> $value #> [1] "tp" #>  use_grib_key_level("typeOfLevel", "heightAboveGround", 2) #> $key #> [1] "typeOfLevel" #>  #> $value #> [1] "heightAboveGround" #>  #> $level #> [1] 2 #>  use_grib_typeOfLevel("heightAboveGround", 2) #> $key #> [1] "typeOfLevel" #>  #> $value #> [1] "heightAboveGround" #>  #> $level #> [1] 2 #>  use_grib_heightAboveGround(2) #> $key #> [1] "typeOfLevel" #>  #> $value #> [1] "heightAboveGround" #>  #> $level #> [1] 2 #>  use_grib_indicatorOfTypeOfLevel(105, 2) #> $key #> [1] "indicatorOfTypeOfLevel" #>  #> $value #> [1] 105 #>  #> $level #> [1] 2 #> title: Generate Transformation Options — interpolate_opts
text: reading gridded data, three transformations available: interpolate, regrid xsection. transformations requires set options, functions used generate options.

title: Generate Transformation Options — interpolate_opts
code: interpolate_opts(   stations,   method = c("nearest", "bilinear", "bicubic", "closest"),   correct_t2m = TRUE,   keep_model_t2m = FALSE,   lapse_rate = 0.0065,   clim_file = NULL,   clim_file_format = NULL,   clim_file_opts = NULL,   clim_param = "sfc_geo",   use_mask = FALSE,   weights = NULL,   keep_raw_data = FALSE )  regrid_opts(   new_domain = NULL,   method = "nearest",   clim_file = NULL,   clim_file_format = NULL,   clim_file_opts = NULL,   clim_param = "sfc_geo",   weights = NULL,   keep_raw_data = FALSE )  xsection_opts(   a,   b,   horizontal_res = 2500,   vertical_res = log(10),   clim_file = NULL,   clim_file_format = NULL,   clim_file_opts = NULL,   clim_param = "sfc_geo",   method = "bilinear",   levels_ascending = TRUE,   keep_raw_data = FALSE,   ... )  subgrid_opts(x1, x2, y1, y2, ...)

title: Generate Transformation Options — interpolate_opts
text: stations data frame points interpolate . Must columns 'SID', station ID, lat latitude lon longitude. method interpolation method. Can 'nearest' 'closest' nearest neighbour interpolation, 'bilinear', 'bicubic'. regrid_opts 'mean' also available upscaling. correct_t2m Logical. Whether make height correction 2m temperature account differences model elevation station elevation. keep_model_t2m Logical. Whether keep uncorrected 2m temperature correct_t2m = TRUE. lapse_rate lapse rate K/m use 2m temperature heigth correction. default standard moist adiabitic lapse rate 0.0065 K/m. clim_file file containing model orography surface geopential grid data read height corrections 2m temperature can made. also contain land sea mask masked interpolation done. initialising domain, parameter, passed 'clim_param' can used. clim_file_format format clim_file. set NULL, guess made. clim_file_opts Options reading clim_file, depending format clim_file. clim_param parameter read 'clim_file'. correct_t2m = TRUE either surface geopotential terrain height meters, otherwise purposes intialising interpolation weights, paramter exists 'clim_file' can used. use_mask Logical. Whether use mask interpolation. Requires 'stations' 'lsm' column clim_file includes land-sea mask. weights Interpolation weights already calculated. keep_raw_data Logical. Whether keep untransformed full gridded data field. default FALSE. new_domain geofield geodomain object grid data regridded. length 2 numeric vector longitude latitude left hand edge cross section. b length 2 numeric vector longitude latitude right hand edge cross section. horizontal_res horizontal grid length cross section meters. default 2500m. vertical_res vertical grid length cross section. data pressure levels model levels hPa. data height levels meters. default log(10). levels_ascending order level values. output levels numbered simple plotting. Set TRUE (default) levels numbered ascending order level values FALSE numbering done descending order. x1 left x index subdomain x2 right x index subdomain y1 bottom y index subdomain y2 top y index subdomain

title: Generate Transformation Options — interpolate_opts
text: list options used transformation.

title: Generate Transformation Options — interpolate_opts
text: interpolate_opts generates options interpolating gridded data points, stations. stations passed, default list stations, accessed harpIO built dataset stations_list used. 2m temperature read, deafult behaviour attempt height correct differences model elevation elevation actual station. default interpolation method nearest-neighbour. regrid_opts generates options regrid data native grid new grid. new grid specified either geofield geodomain object. read_grid can used read geofield, Make.domain can used make geodomain. default interpolation method nearest-neighbour. xsection_opts generates options extract vertical cross section three dimensional gridded data. b denote left right hand extents vertical cross section. defualt cross sections interpolated horizontally 2.5 km grid length. vertical, data model levels pressure levels, converted log(pressure) default interpolated log(10) hPa levels. default interpolation method bilinear interpolation.

ℹ 13,407 more rows #>  #> $method #> [1] "nearest" #>  #> $correct_t2m #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $keep_model_t2m #> [1] FALSE #>  #> $lapse_rate #> [1] 0.0065 #>  #> $clim_file #> NULL #>  #> $clim_file_format #> NULL #>  #> $clim_file_opts #> NULL #>  #> $clim_param #> [1] "sfc_geo" #>  #> $use_mask #> [1] FALSE #>  #> $weights #> NULL #>  #> $keep_raw_data #> [1] FALSE #>  if (requireNamespace("Rgrib2", quietly = TRUE) & requireNamespace("harpData", quietly = TRUE)) {   new_domain = read_grid(     system.file(       "grib/AROME_Arctic/2018/07/10/00/fc2018071000+000grib_fp",       package = "harpData"     ),     parameter = "T2m"   )   regrid_opts(new_domain = new_domain) } #> Reading /home/andrewts/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.3/harpData/grib/AROME_Arctic/2018/07/10/00/fc2018071000+000grib_fp #> $new_domain #> eidb : T Temperature K  #> Time: #>  2018/07/10 00:00 +0 #> Domain summary: #> 100 x 100 domain #> Projection summary: #> proj= lcc  #> NE = ( 23.31109 , 78.2607 ) #> SW = ( 8.042 , 77.968 ) #> Data summary: #> 270.9636 275.1887 276.3596 276.5172 278.2578 279.9568  #>  #> $method #> [1] "nearest" #>  #> $clim_file #> NULL #>  #> $clim_file_format #> NULL #>  #> $clim_file_opts #> NULL #>  #> $clim_param #> [1] "sfc_geo" #>  #> $weights #> NULL #>  #> $keep_raw_data #> [1] FALSE #>  xsection_opts(a = c(5.3, 60.5), b = c(10.8, 59.9)) #> $a #> [1]  5.3 60.5 #>  #> $b #> [1] 10.8 59.9 #>  #> $horizontal_res #> [1] 2500 #>  #> $vertical_res #> [1] 2.302585 #>  #> $clim_file #> NULL #>  #> $clim_file_format #> NULL #>  #> $clim_file_opts #> NULL #>  #> $clim_param #> [1] "sfc_geo" #>  #> $method #> [1] "bilinear" #>  #> $levels_ascending #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $keep_raw_data #> [1] FALSE #>

title: Set Options for Reading NetCDF files — netcdf_opts
code: netcdf_opts(   options_set = c("none", "met_norway_eps", "met_norway_det", "met_norway_ifsens",     "met_norway_ifshires", "wrf", "wrf_u_stagger", "wrf_v_stagger"),   param_find = list(),   proj4_var = "projection_lambert",   proj4_att = "proj4",   proj4 = NULL,   x_dim = "x",   y_dim = "y",   lon_var = "longitude",   lat_var = "latitude",   x_rev = FALSE,   y_rev = FALSE,   dx = NULL,   dy = NULL,   z_var = NA,   member_var = NA,   time_var = "time",   ref_time_var = NA,   force_param_name = FALSE )

title: Set Options for Reading NetCDF files — netcdf_opts
text: options_set set pre-defined options can returned. Currently available data MET Norway. param_find list used map parameter name name variable NetCDF file. name parameter name used read function element name NetCDF file. proj4_var variable holds projection information NetCDF files. Set 0 proj4 string global attribute. proj4_att attribute proj4_var holds proj4 string. proj4 proj4 string available NetCDF files can set . Set "wrf" get proj4 string WRF output files. Note proj4 = NULL attempt made get proj4 string proj4_var proj4_att. proj4 value NULL, proj4_var proj4_att ignored. x_dim name x dimension. y_dim name y dimension. lon_var name longitude dimension. needed get southwest northeast corners domain. Set NULL available attempt made get corners x_dim y_dim projection information. lat_var name latitude dimension. needed get southwest northeast corners domain. Set NULL available attempt made get corners x_dim y_dim projection information. x_rev Set TRUE data x direction reverse order. y_rev Set TRUE data y direction reverse order. dx x resolution data. needs set x dimension file netcdf dimvar. dy y resolution data. needs set y dimension file netcdf dimvar. z_var name z (vertical) dimension. member_var name ensemble member dimension. time_var name time dimension. ref_time_var name variable holding forecast reference time. Set NA derived first value time dimension. force_param_name Logical. Set TRUE force harp look exact parameter name passed rather use lookup table.

code: add_param_def(   param,   param_defs = get("harp_params"),   description = "",   min = -Inf,   max = Inf,   grib = NULL,   netcdf = NULL,   v = NULL,   fa = NULL,   obsoul = NULL,   func = NULL,   ... )  modify_param_def(   param,   param_defs = get("harp_params"),   description = NULL,   min = NULL,   max = NULL,   grib = NULL,   netcdf = NULL,   v = NULL,   fa = NULL,   obsoul = NULL,   func = NULL,   ... )  get_param_def(param, file_format = NULL, param_defs = get("harp_params"))  show_param_defs(file_format = NULL, param_defs = get("harp_params"))

title: Parameter definitions for reading from files — parameter_definitions
text: param name parameter extract param_defs param_defs list parameter definitions modify. Defaults built list parameters. description description parameter. min, max minimum maximumvalues parameter can - used reading observations gross error check. grib list grib shortName, optionally levelType level. Use new_grib_param generate. netcdf list name parameter netcdf file optionally named list suffixes add parameter name different vertical coordinate systems. Use new_netcdf_param generate. v list name parameter vfld / vobs files, output name, units type (synop temp). Use new_v_param generate. fa list name parameter FA files units. Use new_fa_param generate. obsoul list name paramater obsoul files (usually numeric), units output name. Use new_obsoul_param generate. func function apply reading. function used, "name" element list file type must named list names matching names function arguments. See, example, harp_params$ws10m done. ... file types. file_format given, parameter names exist param_defs file format shown.

what: Parse the parameter name and decide on level, accumulation... — parse_harp_parameter
title: Parse the parameter name and decide on level, accumulation... — parse_harp_parameter
text: Parses harp-style parameter name returns accumulation time, level () base name parameter

title: Parse the parameter name and decide on level, accumulation... — parse_harp_parameter
code: parse_harp_parameter(   param,   vertical_coordinate = c(NA_character_, "pressure", "model", "height", "isotherm",     "unknown") )

title: Parse the parameter name and decide on level, accumulation... — parse_harp_parameter
text: param Parameter name - available names can found show_param_defs. vertical_coordinate parameter upper air, vertical coordinate system must given. Can "pressure" pressure levels, "model" model levels "height" altitude levels.

title: Parse the parameter name and decide on level, accumulation... — parse_harp_parameter
text: list (class harp_parameter) fullname, basename, level_type, level, accum

title: Parse the parameter name and decide on level, accumulation... — parse_harp_parameter
code: parse_harp_parameter("AccPcp1h") #> $fullname #> [1] "AccPcp1h" #>  #> $basename #> [1] "Pcp" #>  #> $level #> [1] -999 #>  #> $level_type #> [1] "unknown" #>  #> $accum #> [1] 3600 #>  #> $acc_unit #> [1] "h" #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "harp_parameter" parse_harp_parameter("z500") #> $fullname #> [1] "z500" #>  #> $basename #> [1] "z" #>  #> $level #> [1] 500 #>  #> $level_type #> [1] "pressure" #>  #> $accum #> [1] 0 #>  #> $acc_unit #> NULL #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "harp_parameter" parse_harp_parameter("s100m") #> $fullname #> [1] "s100m" #>  #> $basename #> [1] "s" #>  #> $level #> [1] 100 #>  #> $level_type #> [1] "height" #>  #> $accum #> [1] 0 #>  #> $acc_unit #> NULL #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "harp_parameter" parse_harp_parameter("T", vertical_coordinate = "pressure") #> $fullname #> [1] "T" #>  #> $basename #> [1] "T" #>  #> $level #> [1] -999 #>  #> $level_type #> [1] "pressure" #>  #> $accum #> [1] 0 #>  #> $acc_unit #> NULL #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "harp_parameter" parse_harp_parameter("S", vertical_coordinate = "model") #> $fullname #> [1] "S" #>  #> $basename #> [1] "S" #>  #> $level #> [1] -999 #>  #> $level_type #> [1] "model" #>  #> $accum #> [1] 0 #>  #> $acc_unit #> NULL #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "harp_parameter" parse_harp_parameter("RH", vertical_coordinate = "height") #> $fullname #> [1] "RH" #>  #> $basename #> [1] "RH" #>  #> $level #> [1] -999 #>  #> $level_type #> [1] "height" #>  #> $accum #> [1] 0 #>  #> $acc_unit #> NULL #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "harp_parameter"

what: Read analysis data from multiple files — read_analysis
title: Read analysis data from multiple files — read_analysis
text: read_analysis generates file names, based arguments given, reads data , optionally performs transformation data. Works much read_forecast except dates must given explictly. can generated seq_dates. Also, data returned default. just want use function interpolating points writing results sqlite files, make sure set return_data = FALSE.

title: Read analysis data from multiple files — read_analysis
code: read_analysis(   dttm,   analysis_model,   parameter,   members = NULL,   members_out = members,   lags = NULL,   vertical_coordinate = c("pressure", "model", "height", "depth", NA),   file_path = getwd(),   file_format = NULL,   file_template = "an{YYYY}{MM}{DD}{HH}.grib",   file_format_opts = list(),   transformation = c("none", "interpolate", "regrid", "xsection", "subgrid"),   transformation_opts = NULL,   param_defs = get("harp_params"),   output_file_opts = sqlite_opts(),   return_data = TRUE,   merge_lags = TRUE,   show_progress = TRUE,   stop_on_fail = FALSE,   start_date = NULL,   end_date = NULL,   by = "6h" )

title: Read analysis data from multiple files — read_analysis
text: dttm vector date time strings read. Can YYYYMMDD, YYYYMMDDhh, YYYYMMDDhhmm, YYYYMMDDhhmmss format. Can numeric character. seq_dttm can used generate vector equally spaced date-time strings. analysis_model name analysis model(s) read. Can expressed character vector one model wanted. parameter name forecast parameter(s) read files. either harp parameter names (see show_param_defs), case netcdf files can name parameters files. reading vfld files, set NULL read parameters. members ensemble forecasts, numeric vector giving member numbers read. one forecast model read , members may given single vector, case recycled forecast model, named list, forecast models (given fcst_model) names. multimodel ensembles named list named lists. file names include ensemble member, .e. members file, setting members NULL read members files. members_out members renumbered output, new member numbers given members_out. structure members. lags named list members ensemble forecast model lagged amount lagged. list names names forecast models, given fcst_model lagged members, lags given vectors length members vector. lags numeric, assumed hours, units may specified letter value d = days, h = hours, m = minutes s = seconds. lags primarily used generate correct file names lagged members - example lag 1 hour generate file name date-time 1 hour earlier date-time sequence (start_data, end_date,   = ) lead time 1 hour longer. vertical_coordinate upper air data read vertical coordinate files must given. default, "pressure", may also "height" "model" model levels. reading vfld files, set NA read surface parameters. file_path parent path forecast data. file names generated file_path directory. default current working directory. file_format format files read. harpIO includes functions read 'vfld', 'netcdf', 'grib' 'fa' format files. set NULL, attempt made guess format files. However, may write functions called read_<file_format> function read_forecast attempt use instead. See vignette writing read functions information. file_template template file names. available built templates see show_file_templates. anything else passed, returned unmodified, substitutions made dynamic values. Available substitutions YYYY year, {MM} 2 digit month leading zero, {M} month leading zero, similarly {DD} {D} day, {HH} {H} hour, {mm} {m} minute. Also {LDTx} lead time {MBRx} x length string including leading zeros. Note full path file always file_path/template. file_format_opts list options specific file format. netcdf can generated netcdf_opts grib grib_opts. transformation transformation apply data read . "none" return data original form, "interpolate" interpolate points latitudes longitudes supplied transformation_opts, "regrid" regrid data new domain given transformation_opts, "xsection" interpolate vertical cross sectoin betweem two points given transformation_opts. transformation_opts Options transformation. transformation = "interpolate" can generated interpolate_opts, transformation = "regrid" can generated regrid_opts, transformation =   "xsection" can generated xsection_opts. param_defs list parameter definitions includes file format read. default built list harp_params used. Modifications additions list can made using modify_param_def add_param_def respectively. output_file_opts Options output files. read_forecast can output data transformation = "interpolate" sqlite files. options sqlite files can set sqlite_opts. inportantly, path argument link{sqlite_opts} must NULL data output sqlite files. return_data default read_forecast return data, since many GB data read . Set TRUE return data read global environment. merge_lags Logical. Whether merge lagged members return_data = TRUE (default). TRUE, forecast time lead time lagged members adjusted fit unlagged members. show_progress files may contain lot data. Set TRUE show progress reading files. stop_on_fail Logical. Set TRUE make execution stop problems reading file. Missing files always skipped regardless setting. default value FALSE. start_date, end_date, use start_date, end_date longer supported. dttm together seq_dttm used generate equally spaced date-times.

title: Read deterministic forecast files and interpolate to stations. — read_det_interpolate
text: start_date Date first forecast read . YYYYMMDDhh format. Can numeric charcter. end_date Date last forecast read . YYYYMMDDhh format. Can numeric charcter. det_model name deterministic model. May expressed vector one model wanted. parameter parameters read character vector. reading vfld files, set NULL read parameters, set veritcal_coordinate = NA read surface parameters. See show_harp_parameters get possible parameters. lead_time lead times read numeric vector. time forecasts. string number followed letter (defualt "6h"), letter gives units - may d days, h hours m minutes. file_path path forecast files read. file_path , cases, form part file template. file_format format files read. Can "vfld", "grib", "netcdf", "fa", "fatar". file_template file template files read. available built templates see show_file_templates. anything else passed, returned unmodified, substitutions made dynamic values. Available substitutions YYYY year, {MM} 2 digit month leading zero, {M} month leading zero, similarly {DD} {D} day, {HH} {H} hour, {mm} {m} minute. Also {LDTx} lead time x length string including leading zeros - can omitted 2, 3 4. Note full path file always file_path/template. stations data frame stations columns SID, lat, lon, elev. supplied forecasts interpolated stations. case vfld files, ignored stations found vfld used. case gridded files (e.g. grib, netcdf, FA), data frame stations passed default list stations used. list can accessed via station_list. correct_t2m logical value tell function whether height correct 2m temperature forecast, included parameter argument, model elevation observation elevation. default TRUE. keep_model_t2m logical value tell function whether keep original 2m temperature model well height corrected values. set TRUE parameter gets name "T2m_uncorrcted". default FALSE. lapse_rate lapse rate, Kelvins per meter, use height correcting 2m temperature. defaul 0.0065 K/m. vertical_coordinate upper air multiple levels read, vertical coordinate data given . default "pressure", can also "model" model levels, "height" height ground /sea level. clim_file name file containing information model domain. Must include orography (surface geopotential), can also include land-sea mask. clim_format file format clim_file. Can "grib", "fa", "fatar", "netcdf". interpolation_method interpolation method use. Available methods "bilinear", "bicubic", "nearest". default "nearest", takes nearest grid points stations. use_mask logical value tell function whether include land-sea mask interpolation. land-sea mask must exist either clim_file forecast files. sqlite_path NULL, sqlite files generated written directory specified . sqlite_template template filenames fctable files. See show_file_templates available built templates - forecast sqlite files, templates beginning "fctable_". default "fctable_det". sqlite_synchronous synchronus setting sqlite files. defualt "", also "normal", "full", "extra". See https://www.sqlite.org/pragma.html#pragma_synchronous information. sqlite_journal_mode journal mode sqlite files. default "delete", can also "truncate", "persist", "memory", "wal", "". See https://www.sqlite.org/pragma.html#pragma_journal_mode information. return_data logical indicating whether return read data calling environment. default FALSE avoid memory overload. ... Extra options depending file format.

Must include orography (surface geopotential), can also include land-sea mask. clim_format file format clim_file. Can "grib", "fa", "fatar", "netcdf". interpolation_method interpolation method use. Available methods "bilinear", "bicubic", "nearest". default "nearest", takes nearest grid points stations. use_mask logical value tell function whether include land-sea mask interpolation. land-sea mask must exist either clim_file forecast files. sqlite_path NULL, sqlite files generated written directory specified . sqlite_template template filenames fctable files.
