title: Read forecast data from multiple files — read_forecast
code: read_forecast(   dttm,   fcst_model,   parameter,   lead_time = seq(0, 48, 3),   members = NULL,   members_out = members,   lags = NULL,   vertical_coordinate = c("pressure", "model", "height", NA),   file_path = getwd(),   file_format = NULL,   file_template = "vfld",   file_format_opts = list(),   transformation = c("none", "interpolate", "regrid", "xsection", "subgrid"),   transformation_opts = NULL,   param_defs = get("harp_params"),   output_file_opts = sqlite_opts(),   return_data = FALSE,   merge_lags = TRUE,   show_progress = TRUE,   stop_on_fail = FALSE,   is_forecast = TRUE,   start_date = NULL,   end_date = NULL,   by = "6h" )

title: Read forecast data from multiple files — read_forecast
text: dttm vector date time strings read. Can YYYYMMDD, YYYYMMDDhh, YYYYMMDDhhmm, YYYYMMDDhhmmss format. Can numeric character. seq_dttm can used generate vector equally spaced date-time strings. fcst_model name forecast model(s) read. Can expressed character vector one model wanted, named list character vectors mutlimodel ensemble. parameter name forecast parameter(s) read files. either harp parameter names (see show_param_defs), case netcdf files can name parameters files. reading vfld files, set NULL read parameters. lead_time lead times read . numeric vector passed, lead times assumed hours. Otherwise character vector may passed letter value denote time units: d = days, h = hours, m = minutes, s = seconds. members ensemble forecasts, numeric vector giving member numbers read. one forecast model read , members may given single vector, case recycled forecast model, named list, forecast models (given fcst_model) names. multimodel ensembles named list named lists. file names include ensemble member, .e. members file, setting members NULL read members files. members_out members renumbered output, new member numbers given members_out. structure members. lags named list members ensemble forecast model lagged amount lagged. list names names forecast models, given fcst_model lagged members, lags given vectors length members vector. lags numeric, assumed hours, units may specified letter value d = days, h = hours, m = minutes s = seconds. lags primarily used generate correct file names lagged members - example lag 1 hour generate file name date-time 1 hour earlier date-time sequence (start_data, end_date,   = ) lead time 1 hour longer. vertical_coordinate upper air data read vertical coordinate files must given. default, "pressure", may also "height" "model" model levels. reading vfld files, set NA read surface parameters. file_path parent path forecast data. file names generated file_path directory. default current working directory. file_format format files read. harpIO includes functions read 'vfld', 'netcdf', 'grib' 'fa' format files. set NULL, attempt made guess format files. However, may write functions called read_<file_format> function read_forecast attempt use instead. See vignette writing read functions information. file_template template file names. available built templates see show_file_templates. anything else passed, returned unmodified, substitutions made dynamic values. Available substitutions YYYY year, {MM} 2 digit month leading zero, {M} month leading zero, similarly {DD} {D} day, {HH} {H} hour, {mm} {m} minute. Also {LDTx} lead time {MBRx} x length string including leading zeros. Note full path file always file_path/template. file_format_opts list options specific file format. netcdf can generated netcdf_opts grib grib_opts. transformation transformation apply data read . "none" return data original form, "interpolate" interpolate points latitudes longitudes supplied transformation_opts, "regrid" regrid data new domain given transformation_opts, "xsection" interpolate vertical cross sectoin betweem two points given transformation_opts. transformation_opts Options transformation. transformation = "interpolate" can generated interpolate_opts, transformation = "regrid" can generated regrid_opts, transformation =   "xsection" can generated xsection_opts. param_defs list parameter definitions includes file format read. default built list harp_params used. Modifications additions list can made using modify_param_def add_param_def respectively. output_file_opts Options output files. read_forecast can output data transformation = "interpolate" sqlite files. options sqlite files can set sqlite_opts. inportantly, path argument link{sqlite_opts} must NULL data output sqlite files. return_data default read_forecast return data, since many GB data read . Set TRUE return data read global environment. merge_lags Logical. Whether merge lagged members return_data = TRUE (default). TRUE, forecast time lead time lagged members adjusted fit unlagged members. show_progress files may contain lot data. Set TRUE show progress reading files. stop_on_fail Logical. Set TRUE make execution stop problems reading file. Missing files always skipped regardless setting. default value FALSE. is_forecast Logical. TRUE (default), data read basis forecast initialization time (dttm) lead_times. FALSE date-times dttm used choose data read lead_times ignored. useful analysis data many dates file. read_analysis also provides functionality. start_date, end_date, use start_date, end_date longer supported. dttm together seq_dttm used generate equally spaced date-times.

title: Read forecast data from multiple files — read_forecast
code: if (requireNamespace("harpData", quietly = TRUE)) {    # Read all parameters from vfld files for a deterministic model   read_forecast(     start_date  = 2019021700,     end_date    = 2019021718,     fcst_model  = "AROME_Arctic_prod",     file_path   = system.file("vfld", package = "harpData"),     return_data = TRUE   )    # Ensure height corrections to 2m temperature are done and keep the   # uncorrected data   read_forecast(     start_date          = 2019021700,     end_date            = 2019021718,     fcst_model          = "AROME_Arctic_prod",     file_path           = system.file("vfld", package = "harpData"),     transformation_opts = interpolate_opts(       correct_t2m    = TRUE,       keep_model_t2m = TRUE     ),     return_data = TRUE   )    # Read 10m wind speed from the MEPS_prod ensemble   read_forecast(     start_date    = 2019021700,     end_date      = 2019021718,     fcst_model    = "MEPS_prod",     parameter     = "S10m",     lead_time     = seq(0, 12, 3),     members       = seq(0, 10),     file_path     = system.file("vfld", package = "harpData"),     file_template = "vfld_eps",     return_data   = TRUE   )    # Read vertical profiles of temperature and dewpoint temperature   read_forecast(     start_date    = 2019021700,     end_date      = 2019021718,     fcst_model    = "MEPS_prod",     parameter     = c("T", "Td"),     lead_time     = seq(0, 12, 3),     members       = seq(0, 10),     file_path     = system.file("vfld", package = "harpData"),     file_template = "vfld_eps",     return_data   = TRUE   )    # Read ensemble data from MEPS_prod and lagged ensemble data from   # CMEPS_prod   read_forecast(     start_date    = 2019021700,     end_date      = 2019021718,     fcst_model    = c("MEPS_prod", "CMEPS_prod"),     parameter     = c("T", "Td"),     lead_time     = seq(0, 12, 3),     members       = list(       MEPS_prod = seq(0, 10),       CMEPS_prod = c(0, 1, 3, 4, 5, 6)     ),     lags          = list(CMEPS_prod = c(0, 0, 2, 2, 1, 1)),     file_path     = system.file("vfld", package = "harpData"),     file_template = "vfld_eps",     return_data   = TRUE   ) } #> Warning: The use of what: Read gridded data in various formats — read_grid
title: Read gridded data in various formats — read_grid
text: read_grid generic function read gridded data file. transformation can optionally applied data.

title: Read gridded data in various formats — read_grid
code: read_grid(   file_name,   parameter,   is_forecast = TRUE,   dttm = NULL,   file_format = NULL,   file_format_opts = list(),   vertical_coordinate = c("pressure", "model", "height", NA),   lead_time = NULL,   members = NULL,   transformation = c("none", "interpolate", "regrid", "xsection", "subgrid"),   transformation_opts = list(),   param_defs = get("harp_params"),   show_progress = TRUE,   data_frame = FALSE,   readable_times = TRUE,   spread_members = FALSE,   ... )  read_grid_interpolate(file_name, parameter, file_format = NULL, ...)

title: Read gridded data in various formats — read_grid
text: file_name character string (full) file name. parameter parameter read. is_forecast Logical. TRUE (default), data filtered based forecast initialization time lead time. FALSE, data filtered valid time. dttm vector date time strings form YYYYMMDD, YYYYMMDDhh, YYYYMMDDhhmm, YYYYMMDDhhmmss. forecast data forecast initialization times. seq_dttm can used generate vector equally spaced date-time strings. file_format file format. Possible values include grib, netcdf, FA, hdf5... Whatever value , supposed correspond function "read_XXX" can deal format. specified, format can often guessed correctly file extension first bytes. file_format_opts Options file format generated one options functions, e.g. netcdf_opts. vertical_coordinate vertical coordinate upper air data. May "pressure" pressure levels, "model" model levels "height" height levels. lead_time lead times read forecast file. set NULL, lead times read file. members ensemble data, ensemble members read file. set NULL members read. transformation transformation apply gridded data. Can "none", "interpolate", "regrid" "xsection". transformation_opts Options transformation generated interpolate_opts, regrid_opts xsection_opts. param_defs list parameter definitions includes file format read. default built list harp_params used. Modifications additions list can made using modify_param_def add_param_def respectively. show_progress Show progress reading large amounts data. data_frame Logical. compatibility current version harpSpatial, make sure geofield returned rather data frame set FALSE. readable_times data_frame = TRUE, whether convert times unix format data-time format. default TRUE. spread_members data_frame = TRUE, whether spread members column member. ... arguments passed specified reader function.

title: Read gridded data in various formats — read_grid
text: geofield (possibly) plain  matrix.

title: Read gridded data in various formats — read_grid
code: if (requireNamespace("Rgrib2", quietly = TRUE) & requireNamespace("harpData", quietly = TRUE)) {   read_grid(     system.file(       "grib/AROME_Arctic/2018/07/10/00/fc2018071000+000grib_fp",       package = "harpData"     ),     parameter = "T2m"   )   read_grid(     system.file(       "grib/AROME_Arctic/2018/07/10/00/fc2018071000+000grib_fp",        package = "harpData"     ),     parameter = "S10m"   )   read_grid(     system.file(       "grib/AROME_Arctic/2018/07/10/00/fc2018071000+000grib_fp",        package = "harpData"     ),     parameter = "tcc"   ) } #> Reading /home/andrewts/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.3/harpData/grib/AROME_Arctic/2018/07/10/00/fc2018071000+000grib_fp #> Reading /home/andrewts/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.3/harpData/grib/AROME_Arctic/2018/07/10/00/fc2018071000+000grib_fp #> Reading /home/andrewts/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.3/harpData/grib/AROME_Arctic/2018/07/10/00/fc2018071000+000grib_fp #> eidb : TCC Total cloud cover   #> Time: #>  2018/07/10 00:00 +0 #> Domain summary: #> 100 x 100 domain #> Projection summary: #> proj= lcc  #> NE = ( 23.31109 , 78.2607 ) #> SW = ( 8.042 , 77.968 ) #> Data summary: #> 0.01281738 1 1 0.9805575 1 1

what: Read point observations from multiple files — read_obs
title: Read point observations from multiple files — read_obs
text: read_obs generates file names, based arguments given reads point observations data . data can optionally re-written files different format. Due large volumes data may read, function return data calling environment return_data = TRUE

title: Read point observations from multiple files — read_obs
code: read_obs(   dttm,   parameter,   param_defs = get("harp_params"),   stations = NULL,   file_path = getwd(),   file_format = NULL,   file_template = "vobs",   file_format_opts = vfile_opts("vobs"),   output_format = "obstable",   output_format_opts = obstable_opts(),   return_data = FALSE,   start_date = NULL,   end_date = NULL,   by = "1h",   reads_per_write = 24,   ... )

title: Read point observations from multiple files — read_obs
text: dttm vector date time strings read. Can YYYYMMDD, YYYYMMDDhh, YYYYMMDDhhmm, YYYYMMDDhhmmss format. Can numeric character. vector date-times can generated using seq_dttm. parameter names parameters read. default NULL, meaning parameters read observations files. param_defs list parameter definitions includes file format read. default built list harp_params used. Modifications additions list can made using modify_param_def add_param_def respectively. stations IDs stations read files. default NULL, meaning observations stations read observations files. file_path parent path forecast data. file names generated file_path directory. default current working directory. file_format format files read. default "vobs", standard format used HIRLAM consortium. set something else, read_obs search global environment function called read_<file_format> use read files. file_template template file names. available built templates see show_file_templates. anything else passed, returned unmodified, substitutions made dynamic values. Available substitutions YYYY year, {MM} 2 digit month leading zero, {M} month leading zero, similarly {DD} {D} day, {HH} {H} hour, {mm} {m} minute. Note full path file always file_path/template. substitutions can passed via ... file_format_opts Specific options reading file format specified file_format. named list, names corresponding argument read_<file_format>. output_format file format re-write data . default "obstable", sqlite file desgined specifically harp ecosystem. set something else, read_obs search global environment function called write_<file_format> use write output file(s). output_format_opts Specific options writing file_format files. Must named list least include names "path" "template". setting output_format_opts$path something NULL, read_obs attempt write data. return_data Logical - whether return data read calling environment. Due potential large volumes data, set FALSE default. start_date, end_date, use start_date, end_date longer supported. dttm together seq_dttm used generate equally spaced date-times. reads_per_write number files read writing data new files. Set low number reduce memory usage. default 24 based assumption observations files every hour writing done per observation day. default setting writing "obstable" files, number impact output since files can appended . formats, setting might important prevent data overwritten. ... arguments generate_filenames getting names files read.

title: Read point observations from multiple files — read_obs
text: return_data = TRUE, list data frames observations.

title: Read point observations from multiple files — read_obs
text: read_obs intended used reading gridded observations. use read_analysis instead.

what: Read observations and output to sqlite OBSTABLE file(s) — read_obs_convert
title: Read observations and output to sqlite OBSTABLE file(s) — read_obs_convert
text: function deprecated read_obs much flexible.

title: Read observations and output to sqlite OBSTABLE file(s) — read_obs_convert
code: read_obs_convert(   start_date,   end_date,   by = "3h",   obs_path = ".",   obs_format = "vobs",   obsfile_template = "vobs",   parameter = NULL,   sqlite_path = NULL,   sqlite_template = "obstable",   return_data = FALSE,   iterations_per_write = 24,   sqlite_synchronous = c("off", "normal", "full", "extra"),   sqlite_journal_mode = c("delete", "truncate", "persist", "memory", "wal", "off"),   ... )

title: Read observations and output to sqlite OBSTABLE file(s) — read_obs_convert
text: start_date Date first observations read . YYYYMMDDhh format. Can numeric charcter. end_date Date last observations read . YYYYMMDDhh format. Can numeric charcter. time observations. string number followed letter (defualt "6h"), letter gives units - may d days, h hours m minutes. obs_path path input observation files. obs_path , cases, form part file template. obs_format format input observation files. Currently "vobs". obsfile_template template observation files. Currently "vobs". parameter used vobs. sqlite_path NULL, sqlite files generated written directory specified . sqlite_template template sqlite observations file. default "obstable", "sqlite_path/OBSTABLE_YYYY.sqlite". return_data Whether return data calling environment. default FALSE. iterations_per_write number iterations "" write sqlite file. default 24. sqlite_synchronous synchronus setting sqlite files. defualt "", also "normal", "full", "extra". See https://www.sqlite.org/pragma.html#pragma_synchronous information. sqlite_journal_mode journal mode sqlite files. default "delete", can also "truncate", "persist", "memory", "wal", "". See https://www.sqlite.org/pragma.html#pragma_journal_mode information. ... Arguments read functions. currently used.

title: Read observations and output to sqlite OBSTABLE file(s) — read_obs_convert
text: return_data TRUE - list four data frames - one synop (near surface) observations, one units synop observations, one temp (upper air) observations, one units temp observations.

title: Read an observations file — read_obs_file
text: function reading observations file. data geographic points either single vertical level, multiple vertical levels.

title: Read an observations file — read_obs_file
code: read_obs_file(   file_name,   parameter,   param_defs = get("harp_params"),   dttm = NULL,   stations = NULL,   file_format = NULL,   file_format_opts = list(),   ... )

title: Read an observations file — read_obs_file
text: file_name full path file read. parameter Parameters extract file. missing NULL, parameters extracted file. param_defs list parameter definitions includes file format read. default built list harp_params used. Modifications additions list can made using modify_param_def add_param_def respectively. dttm date times extract file. NULL, date times extracted file. seq_dttm can used generate vector equally spaced date-time strings. stations Station IDs extract file. NULL, station IDs extracted file. file_format format file read. file_format_opts Options specific file format named list. ... used - absorbs arguments calling environment.

title: Read an observations file — read_obs_file
text: named list four elements synop - data frame observations single vertical level. temp - data frame observations multiple vertical levels. synop_params - data frame units accumulation times parameters synop. temp_params - data frame units accumulation times parameters temp.

title: Read an observations file — read_obs_file
text: file format guessed explicitly passed options file format passed list via file_format_opts argument. interpolation done function. reading interpolating gridded observations, use read_analysis.

what: Read point forecasts from FCTABLE files — read_point_forecast
title: Read point forecasts from FCTABLE files — read_point_forecast
text: Reads point forecasts sqlite file produced read_eps_interpolate read_det_interpolate. function generates file names start date, end date, forecast model(s), parameter, lead time etc. supplied arguments. members, stations, forecast dates lead times retrieved files can also passed arguments.

title: Read point forecasts from FCTABLE files — read_point_forecast
code: read_point_forecast(   dttm,   fcst_model,   fcst_type,   parameter,   lead_time = seq(0, 48, 3),   lags = "0s",   merge_lags = TRUE,   file_path = ".",   file_template = "fctable",   drop_any_na = TRUE,   stations = NULL,   members = NULL,   accumulate = TRUE,   vertical_coordinate = c(NA_character_, "pressure", "model", "height"),   get_lat_and_lon = FALSE,   force_param_name = FALSE,   start_date = NULL,   end_date = NULL,   by = "6h" )

title: Read point forecasts from FCTABLE files — read_point_forecast
text: dttm vector date time strings read. Can YYYYMMDD, YYYYMMDDhh, YYYYMMDDhhmm, YYYYMMDDhhmmss format. Can numeric character. seq_dttm can used generate vector equally spaced date-time strings. fcst_model forecast model read - typically used construct file name. Can character vector model names. fcst_type type forecast read. Set "det" deterministic "eps" ensemble. parameter forecast parameter read. usually used construct filename, accumumlating precipitation. lead_time lead times retrieved. Can used construct file names set lead times retrieved. lags lags used forecast run. , example, FCTABLE files constructed lagged model runs lags must given ensure correct file names generated. , however, simply want add lagged members forecast, using lag_forecast. merge_lags logical , set TRUE (default), lagged ensemble members shifted time joined parent forecast derived start_date . file_path path data. file_template template file names files read . normally one "fctable_*" templates can seen show_file_templates. Can single string, character vector list length fcst_model. named, order templates assumed fcst_model. named, names must match entries fcst_model. drop_any_na Set TRUE (default) remove cases least one missing value. ensures come analyse forecast, forecasts full set ensmeble members / data read . reading lagged ensembles, automatically set FALSE. cases least one missing member dropped lagged members created using lag_forecast. stations stations retrieve forecasts . vector station ID numbers. Set NULL retrieve stations. members members retrieve reading EPS forecast. select members forecast models, numeric vector. specific members specific models named list element name forecast model containing numeric vector. e.g. members = list(eps_model1 = seq(0, 3), eps_model2 = c(2,   3)).  multi model ensembles, element named list contain another named list sub model name followed desired members, e.g. members = list(eps_model1 = list(sub_model1 =   seq(0, 3), sub_model2 = c(2, 3))) accumulate TRUE FALSE. Whether automatically accumulate parameters based accumulation time. Set FALSE data read already accumulated. vertical_coordinate upper air multiple levels read, vertical coordinate data given . default "pressure", can also "model" model levels, "height" height ground /sea level. get_lat_and_lon Logical indicating whether also extract latitude longitude point forecasts sqlite files. force_param_name Logical. Default FALSE. Force parameter name file template. upper air data assumed vertical profiles data files vertical level information removed constructing file name. want full parameter name used file name set TRUE. start_date, end_date, use start_date, end_date longer supported. dttm together seq_dttm used generate equally spaced date-times.

title: Read point forecasts from FCTABLE files — read_point_forecast
text: list element forecast model, case multi model ensemble, another list element sub model. list elements contain data frame columns station ID (SID), forecast initialisation time (fcdate), lead time (leadtime), time forecast valid (validdate), column forecast heading model name case deterministic forecast, multiple columns heading names usually form <model_name>_mbrXXX, XXX member number, case ensemble forecast.

title: Read point forecasts from FCTABLE files — read_point_forecast
text: case lagged forecasts, lagged members created stage, lags argument used ensure necessary data creating lagged members read .

title: Read point forecasts from FCTABLE files — read_point_forecast
code: if (requireNamespace("harpData", quietly = TRUE)) {   # Read data from one deterministic model   read_point_forecast(     start_date = 2019021700,     end_date   = 2019021718,     fcst_model = "AROME_Arctic_prod",     fcst_type  = "det",     parameter  = "S10m",     by         = "6h",     file_path  = system.file("FCTABLE/deterministic", package = "harpData")   )    # Read data from more than one deterministic model   read_point_forecast(     start_date = 2019021700,     end_date   = 2019021718,     fcst_model = c("AROME_Arctic_prod", "MEPS_prod"),     fcst_type  = "det",     parameter  = "S10m",     by         = "6h",     file_path  = system.file("FCTABLE/deterministic", package = "harpData")   )    # Reading ensemble data works exactly the same way, but with fcst_type = "eps".   # Note that all lead times are combined in the same file so   # file_template = "fctable_eps_all_leads".   read_point_forecast(     start_date    = 2019021700,     end_date      = 2019021718,     fcst_model    = "MEPS_prod",     fcst_type     = "eps",     parameter     = "T2m",     lead_time     = seq(0, 12, 3),     by            = "6h",     file_path     = system.file("FCTABLE/ensemble", package = "harpData"),     file_template = "fctable_eps_all_leads"   )    # You can select which members you want to read   read_point_forecast(     start_date    = 2019021700,     end_date      = 2019021718,     fcst_model    = "MEPS_prod",     fcst_type     = "eps",     parameter     = "T2m",     lead_time     = seq(0, 12, 3),     by            = "6h",     file_path     = system.file("FCTABLE/ensemble", package = "harpData"),     file_template = "fctable_eps_all_leads",     members       = c(0, 3, 6)   )    # If reading in vertical profiles, you must specify the vertical coordinate   read_point_forecast(     start_date          = 2019021700,     end_date            = 2019021718,     fcst_model          = "MEPS_prod",     fcst_type           = "eps",     parameter           = "T",     lead_time           = seq(0, 12, 3),     by                  = "6h",     file_path           = system.file("FCTABLE/ensemble", package = "harpData"),     file_template       = "fctable_eps_all_leads",     members             = c(0, 3, 6),     vertical_coordinate = "pressure"   )    # When reading a lagged ensemble, the lags must be set for times at which   # lagged members exist. what: Read point observations from OBSTABLE files — read_point_obs
title: Read point observations from OBSTABLE files — read_point_obs
text: Data read directly OBSTABLE files modification except case precipitation accumulations. possible, observations available given accumulation time, derived observations accumulation times, either subtraction addition.

title: Read point observations from OBSTABLE files — read_point_obs
code: read_point_obs(   dttm,   parameter,   obs_path = ".",   obsfile_template = "obstable",   gross_error_check = TRUE,   min_allowed = NULL,   max_allowed = NULL,   stations = NULL,   vertical_coordinate = c(NA_character_, "pressure", "model", "height"),   start_date = NULL,   end_date = NULL,   by = "1h" )

title: Read point observations from OBSTABLE files — read_point_obs
text: dttm vector date time strings read. Can YYYYMMDD, YYYYMMDDhh, YYYYMMDDhhmm, YYYYMMDDhhmmss format. Can numeric character. seq_dttm can used generate vector equally spaced date-time strings. Alternatively valid date-times can extracted forecast data frame harp_list forecast data frames using unique_valid_dttm. parameter parameter read. normally harp parameter name. obs_path path OBSTABLE files obsfile_template template OBSTABLE file name. gross_error_check Logical whether perform gross error check. min_allowed minimum value observation allow gross error check. set NULL default value parameter used. max_allowed maximum value observation allow gross error check. set NULL default value parameter used. stations stations retrieve observations . vector station ID numbers. Set NULL retrieve stations. vertical_coordinate upper air multiple levels read, vertical coordinate data given . default "pressure", can also "model" model levels, "height" height ground /sea level. start_date, end_date, use start_date, end_date longer supported. dttm together seq_dttm used generate equally spaced date-times.

title: Read point observations from OBSTABLE files — read_point_obs
text: tibble columns valid_dttm, SID parameter.

title: Read point observations from OBSTABLE files — read_point_obs
code: if (requireNamespace("harpData", quietly = TRUE)) {   read_point_obs(     seq_dttm(2019021700, 2019022023),     "T2m",     obs_path = system.file("OBSTABLE", package = "harpData")   )    # stations can be specified using a vector of station ID numbers   read_point_obs(     seq_dttm(2019021700, 2019022023),     "T2m",     obs_path = system.file("OBSTABLE", package = "harpData"),     stations = c(1001, 1010)   )    # Gross error checks are done automatically but the allowable values   # can be changed with min_allowed and max_allowed.   obs <- read_point_obs(     seq_dttm(2019021700, 2019022023),     "T2m",     obs_path = system.file("OBSTABLE", package = "harpData"),     min_allowed = 260,     max_allowed = 280   )    # The removed observations are stored in the attribute "bad_obs"   attr(obs, "bad_obs")    # For vertical profiles, the vertical coordinate must be specified   read_point_obs(     seq_dttm(2019021700, 2019022023),     "Z",     obs_path            = system.file("OBSTABLE", package = "harpData"),     vertical_coordinate = "pressure"   ) } #> Getting T2m. #>  #> Reading: /home/andrewts/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.3/harpData/OBSTABLE/OBSTABLE_2019.sqlite #> Warning: 142 observations removed due to gross error check. #> Getting T2m. #>  #> Reading: /home/andrewts/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.3/harpData/OBSTABLE/OBSTABLE_2019.sqlite #> Getting T2m. #>  #> Reading: /home/andrewts/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.3/harpData/OBSTABLE/OBSTABLE_2019.sqlite #> Warning: 147549 observations removed due to gross error check. #> Getting Z. #>  #> Reading: /home/andrewts/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.3/harpData/OBSTABLE/OBSTABLE_2019.sqlite #> # what: Options for Writing SQLite files — sqlite_opts
title: Options for Writing SQLite files — sqlite_opts
text: Generate list passing output_format_opts argument read_forecast read_obs. sqlite_opts general set options, also suitable forecast data, fctable_opts obstable_opts specific defaults used read_forecast read_obs respectively.

title: Options for Writing SQLite files — sqlite_opts
code: sqlite_opts(   path = NULL,   template = "fctable_det",   index_cols = c("fcst_dttm", "lead_time", "SID"),   synchronous = c("off", "normal", "full", "extra"),   journal_mode = c("delete", "truncate", "persist", "memory", "wal", "off"),   remove_model_elev = FALSE )  fctable_opts(   path = NULL,   template = "fctable",   index_cols = c("fcst_dttm", "lead_time", "SID"),   synchronous = c("off", "normal", "full", "extra"),   journal_mode = c("delete", "truncate", "persist", "memory", "wal", "off"),   remove_model_elev = FALSE )  obstable_opts(   path = NULL,   template = "obstable",   index_cols = "auto",   synchronous = c("off", "normal", "full", "extra"),   journal_mode = c("delete", "truncate", "persist", "memory", "wal", "off") )

title: Options for Writing SQLite files — sqlite_opts
text: path NULL, sqlite files generated written directory specified . template template filenames sqlite files. See show_file_templates available built templates - point forecast sqlite files, templates beginning "fctable_". default "fctable_det". index_cols columns index . case obstable_opts, setting index cols "auto" (default) automatically assign index columns. synchronous synchronus setting sqlite files. defualt "", also "normal", "full", "extra". See https://www.sqlite.org/pragma.html#pragma_synchronous information. journal_mode journal mode sqlite files. default "delete", can also "truncate", "persist", "memory", "wal", "". See https://www.sqlite.org/pragma.html#pragma_journal_mode information. remove_model_elev Set TRUE include model elevation sqlite output files. multi model ensembles, members different model elevations make impossible include members row thus break unique constraints row indexing.

title: Options for Writing SQLite files — sqlite_opts
text: list options writing sqlite files

title: Options for Writing SQLite files — sqlite_opts

title: harpIO 0.2.1
text: HOTFIX Released 5th December 2024 version includes improvements reading NetCDF files bug fixes

title: harpIO 0.2.1
text: Fix bug whereby read_point_obs() failed accumulation periods available SQLite file Add “ws” list known parameters parse_harp_parameter()

title: harpIO 0.2.1
text: projection string available, get projection information CF compliant attributes Get dimension names variables. general means dimension names longer need set via netcdf_opts()

title: harpIO 0.2.1
text: Vignette added describing read point observations .csv files Extra note added help users install hsf5r package

title: harpIO 0.2.0
text: version released November 2023 includes many internal changes make experience smoother includes informative error messages.

title: harpIO 0.2.0
text: Arguments start_date, end_date, read functions deprecated replaced dttm, used together seq_dttm() generate sequence date-time strings. Note can still use old arguments, periodically warned change. New column names outputs read functions bind_fcst() deprecated. bind() used instead. get_filenames() deprecated. generate_filenames() used instead. msub() deprecated. psub() used instead. read_det_interpolate() read_eps_interpolate() defunct. read_forecast(..., transformation = "interpolate") used instead. read_obs_convert() defunct. read_obs(..., transformation = "...") used instead.

title: harpIO 0.2.0
text: Parameters defined via internal data list harp_params. list includes parameter name substitutions different file formats possibility apply function specific parameters read time. parameter list can added modified add_param_def() modify_param_def() respectively. data read harp read functions attain class - print method class tells type dataset . One exception read_obs() read_point_obs(), return basic tibbles (data frames). use_grib_stepRange() added helper select grib messages via grib_opts(param_find = list(param = use_grib_stepRange(...))). useful determining accumulated instantaneous variables grib shortName. {lead_time} can used take current lead time.

title: harpIO 0.0.9
text: version basically unchanged since late 2021 / early 2022. officially tagged v0.0.9 November 2023

what: Update of grib and FA handling
title: harpIO 0.0.0.9168
text: version harp requires newest version meteogrid >= 3.8.5 work. reading grib files Rgrib2 >= 1.4.0 work. noted Rgrib2 1.4.0 backwards compatible older versions harpIO.

title: harpIO 0.0.0.9160
text: fcst_type = “eps” default template “fctable_eps”. separated lead time separate file consistent files output read_eps_interpolate() consisent HARPv2. read_eps_interpolate() soon deprecated recommend using read_forecast() instead output_file_opts = sqlite_opts(...) default template “fctable”, combines lead times single file. read_point_forecast() now consistent read_forecast() using “fctable” default template. get previous functionality need set file_template = "fctable_eps" call read_point_forecast(). deterministic data change impact.
